description:
We had a very nice experience at New Delhi Restaurant. The food was very authentic and we loved the ambience as well.

Would definitely visit once again and will give recommend to other people as well.
author: Vivan B.

description:
This place is roomy, the staff is friendly, and the flavors were great. On first glance, I was a little worried that the portions weren't going to be enough, but we came away full from an entree-per-person order.

After we finished, the proprietor came over and asked us how we were doing. I think I heard that this place was one of the oldest Indian restaurants in the city, and I'm curious to ask more the next time I go
author: Adam F.

description:
We stumbled into this because of the reviews we saw on yelp.
So worth the stop. Authentic Indian dishes.
The wait people are so wonderful, polite and helpful. 
I'm coming back! And I'm recommending this to others.
author: Deann L.

description:
Food: other reviews are correct that this more soupy than other places; BUT I thought the flavor was amazing. The curries have more veggies and stuff in them so while it IS soupier and less of a smooth cream - it was still delicious. 

Price: higher than what I think it's worth - $16-$20 is expensive for the amount of food. 

Vibe: cool interior with long columns - service was slow and underwhelming. 

Overall, I wouldn't go back.
author: Alex H.

description:
Chef Dey recently catered our 300 person wedding in Hopland, Calfornia this past June-- and it was no small feat! I have a Bengali background and my husbands family is Italian -- we wanted to have an Indian buffet that catered to a variety of tastes. 

It was actually really fun to plan the wedding menu with Chef Dey. He set up a tasting for the family -- he listened to our favorites and put together a sample menu.  We were able to have a great meal and to take notes and talk with him about what dishes we loved, what we would like to change. 

For the food -- I LOVED the chaat canapés -- chaat is my favorite thing and the way Chef Dey creates them is perfect for cocktail hour at a wedding. We also had dishes that reminded me of Kolkata like Kosha Mangsho (a lamb dish) and Macher Kalia (catfish in a Bengali style sauce). The only thing that made us sad was on the wedding day we didn't get a chance tohave the mushroom paneer or the rose water roshogollas but that's only because our guests loved them so much -- but we are definitely going to head to the restaurant for more.

What I really appreciate is his empathy and attention to detail -- we were worried as some of our friends have strict dietary restrictions and he was kind enough to create a small batch which he served directly to those friends. 

On top of all of that, our wedding venue was over 2 hours from San Francisco and because it was outdoors he had to set up his own work area and was able to manage to keep the food hot and delicious! 

Chef Deys staff also did a great job serving at the wedding. They were all very friendly and polite -- I also appreciated how well everyone worked with our wedding coordinator. There were a lot of moving pieces and everything went smoothly!
author: Konina B.

description:
I had the Meal Pal dish here with egg plants and chicken and it was actually pretty good. It comes with a nice lentil salad and a bunch of rice.

I liked especially how the rice was made because it was rather fragrant and they did leave these pods in that was the source of the fragrance. Overall quite enjoyable!

The eggplant dish was also very well seasoned and went nicely with the rice. The lentils were a little plain but still pretty good.

Overall a nice choice for the area.
author: Tyler T.

description:
Came here for dinner with my boyfriend.  The inside is upscale for an Indian restaurant and I normally don't trust white tablecloths... but ranjans restaurant did not disappoint.

The menu had so many different options, it was hard to decide what to order! 

Our waitress recommend 2 items off the unique specials side.  We decided to get saag and the madras tamarind chicken.

To start, we got the alu chat choustade. 

Omg the alu starter was awesome!  Although it was served cold, it was super flavorful, a bit spicy and delicate.  I ate 3 of them in less than 5 min! 

The saag was pretty good.  The chicken madras was really good.  Nice mix of sweet and spicy. 

Ranjan owned several restaurants in Hong Kong before opening in SF so it was great to connect with him and hear about his past.  He is so friendly and welcoming. 

He treated us to complimentary dessert, a rice pudding and a Gulab jamun. 

Yum yum!
author: Kimberly L.

description: Despite of poor review I came here, regretting badly! Look at this curry, just see how much watery it is, so dull! Very poorly welcomed, we were treated like we were there to eat for free :( won't be going here again.
author: Maulik S.

description: Not sure why this place has such a bad rap. Yes the curries are a bit dilute but that didn't bother any of us. I took family who was visiting from India and everybody had a good time. The place has high ceilings and tall columns, history written into the menu, paintings on the walls... I'm used to eating in Indian restaurants that look like they're falling apart, so I had a good experience.
author: Neil S.

description:
We arrived at 9:10 pm and were informed that the kitchen would close at 9:30pm.
The order was taken in a rush and we were surprised to see the rather small quantity of food served . 
The biriyani was more of a pulao while the bengali kosha mutton curry was anything but that . 
My friends and I were hugely disappointed.
Would not call this a fine dining experience.
author: Amrita R.

description:
- Friendly Service
- Plentiful seating
- The curries and masalas are very thin and liquidy, just like they were while in Bangalore, India a couple months back. As far as I'm concerned we've in general become accustomed to a thicker sauce here in the states. The flavors where all there though: pungent and rich.

Best part: fresh out of the fryer gulab jamun hot enough to make a memorable burn in your mouth. Never forget.
author: Christopher D.

description:
Decent indian food, but not the best I've had. Its pricey with small portions and not very spicey.

Ordered lamb biryani, lamb curry and garlic naan (naan was delicious tho).

But, customer service was great!

Giving only 3/5 stars because the birayani could've used more spices and seasoning. The portions were so small for $20.00 plates, small plates and portions dont equal high class food or tasty food! This place wasnt that fancy either (it was nice but not a 4 or 5 star restaurant worth). 

They definitely count on tourist or people working downtown for their business, otherwise this is a very simple-basic expensive indian restaurant that will leave you feeling satisfied but not impressed or extremely happy.
author: Noorafi A.

description:
Got the achari baingan and malai kofta with garlic naan . 
Naan was a bit underwhelming 
The achari entree was very different and interesting, kofta standard. 
Service good 

Since I checked in on yelp I got the 50% off second entree offer. When presented, it was decided that vegetarian entrees do not qualify.  That was bizarre and did not seem right.
author: Vasini G.

description:
This is one of our very favorite Indian restaurants in San Francisco. The ambience and food is fantastic. The owner, Ranjan Dey, is very welcoming and accommodating and personally comes to your table to hear about your likes and dislikes. He'll patiently answer your questions and make recommendation based on your likes and dislikes. Our favorites so far are Kosha Mangsho, Achari chicken, biryani, lemon mustard fish, mustard gobi, Kashmiri Naan and of course the very unique cocktails. 
We hosted our daughter's first birthday party in this restaurant and are very happy with all the arrangements and services rendered. Our guests thoroughly enjoyed the unique flavors of this restaurant. 
I highly recommend this restaurant- please step in and try Indian food with a hint of East Indian flavors.
author: Parveen A.

description:
Since the hotel bar closed at 11 P.M., the hotel staff told us to try "the place across the street" for cocktails.  I thought for a second that the hotel employee thought I was asking about dining options.

Surprisingly, New Delhi really has a bar with a decent selection of spirits.  The bartender was nice and explained why Union Square is pretty limited in food and drink selections at night.

$16.00 for two cocktails (not watered down either) was a-ok with me.
author: Nik L.

description: Went for lunch and ordred the chef selections for 2. Started with three appetizer assortment which war vegetarian and very flavorful. Then proceeded to 3 options four main course of lamb, chicken, and spinach.  All was served with basmati rice and some of the best non I have ever put in my mouth! The atmosphere was relaxed and attractive. The service was unobtrusive and  unassuming.  The desert portion was a wonderful sticky rice mango cordial with served with hot chai latte.  I'm not certain about some of the post but for us it was a very positive experience all the way around.
author: RJ C.

description:
Convenient location, attentive service and delicious food. 

We ordered, and enjoyed:
- Palak kofta Kashmiri: really tasty!
- Paneer tikka masala: great flavor! I liked it even more than the the same dish in other places. 
- Mustard Gobi: mild lemony flavor and good spicing.
author: Daisy R.

description:
The food quality s horrible. The curries are all water. Do not waste money in this restaurant at all. I asked the owner to return the food for refund. He declined.

It's a trash food.

In addition the chef guy is commenting BS on my review. Nobody offered return. In addition there are other comments with the same 'watery curry' issue. Doesn't look like they have high standard any day..
author: Aashka S.

description:
Very nice indian restaurant!! I think one of the most elegant indian restaurants around with nicely decorated interior. Food- much better than boasting indian cuisine restaurants i can say if you are a malai kofta fan, this place serves close to real malai kofta with cheese balls unlike all bay area restaurants serving vegetable kofta with name of malai kofta  

Ambience 9/10
Food- 8/10
Service 8/10
Restroom cleanliness 1/10

I totally recommend this place for close to fine dinning experience.
author: Ankur G.

description: Staff was friendly and helpful. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and my friend had the mustard lemon fish. Both were really good. Would definitely visit again if I'm back in San Francisco!
author: Marci R.

description: $23 for watery Tica masala and small box of rice. It's a ripoff don't go to this restaurant.
author: Abenezer A.

description:
I LOVe New Delhi
The atmosphere is so over the top atmospheric and grand
The staff is charming 
The food ambrosial 
Love it every time I come
author: Thomas C.

description: Loved the interior decor and music, very soothing... we loved the food too! Simple and tasty...
author: Mythri R.

description:
The decor of the restaurant is extremely good, and the ambience of the restaurant reminds of the old Indian royal charm.

The food tasted good just like home made dishes, simple but very tasty.
author: Vinay R.

description:
The food here is wonderful, clean and fast service.
The entire staff is friendly and very accommodating. I would recommend this place for a great Indian food.
author: Jaya G.

description: This place has the best atmosphere, the food is amazing, the servers are perfect , and the atmosphere is warm and inviting . Best Indian restaurant in the area .
author: Cheyenne S.

description:
I don't know why you'd ever go here instead of to the nearby alternatives like Little Delhi or Punjab Kabab House, or countless better places across SF. 

This place has tiny, expensive portions ($18+ per entree served in a shallow 5 or 6-inch diameter bowl!?!), tasteless food, and slow service. 

Where they clearly HAVE spent their $ is on decor and marketing. Their plates are beautiful. Their menu is beautifully produced and even tries to connect their clay pots with "the holy Ganges river" -- LOL. Definitely a place that puts form over function... which is a huge miss since the "function" here should be "making tasty food"!!!

Overall, it's a terrible value, bad quality -- don't go until they make some major changes.
author: Honest I.

description: We hosted a team dinner of 40 at New Delhi Restaurant, and the group loved it. The food was great -- folks especially loved the lamb and saag dishes curries, the pakoras, and the samosas -- and the service was top-notch. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Christian G.

description:
This is a spacious Indian restaurant with friendly staff, quick service and a good variety of Indian dishes. 
We had the Murg (Chicken) Agbari, the Vegetable Korma, rice, nan bread, a lassi (yogurt) drink and mango chutney. The curry sauces were tasty and interesting and the chicken and vegetables were excellent. 
The location, near Union Square, was very convenient. We 3njoyed our evening there!
author: Michael O.

description:
I've rarely had good Indian food experiences in the US. I visited New Delhi restuarant one evening after work hoping to get an early dinner.
I ordered for appetizers (aaloo tiki,aaloo chaat croustade and dal soup) ,  the food was surprisingly good. Not the way I would've wanted it, not the New Delhi style, but definitely something I'd come back for.
The customer service however was below that of an average McDonald's, the servers didn't seem to care, and it seemed like a poorly run place. 
Will definitely come back for entrees.
author: Rohit P.

description: Food was absolutely delicious. 2 chicken tikka masala, 3 garlic nan, 4 rice (small portions), 1 paneer pakora, 3 sprites and 4 beers = $100. Check in on yelp and get 50% off one entree. Food 5 stars . Service 2 stars bc super slow response time although food came out quickly, but they were friendly  . Super slow wait staff. I'm only giving 4 stars because of the food.
author: Dana B.

description: So glad I found this place. Superb Malai Kofta but it tasted really different than anything I had before. Naan was so damn soft. One thing to remember is that most of vegetable dishes are considered side dishes on the menu here so portion size is according to that. Also it doesn't qualify for 50% offer. I am just saying because another Yelper mentioned about it. Great location, one block from Hilton where I was staying so that was really great. A lot of Indian restaurants in the area are on the border of Tenderloin so this location makes it an easy choice. And also notice the Health Score which is 90+ so I don't know what more can I ask for.
author: Shai K.

description:
We stayed in San Francisco for one night and wanted to eat a nice Indian place. This was right across from our hotel, so we tried it and were very happy. We were able to make reservations online through Open Table. 

The restaurant is decorated very nicely in vintage furniture, ambience--all reminiscent of Raj-era places. The service was very friendly, efficient, and attentive. The food is very delicious with large portions. We really enjoyed the entire experience. The restaurant also has a separate bar area that seemed very popular with a bunch of local people from the neighborhood hanging out there. Highly recommend if you are looking for a place in the area in downtown San Francisco. We will go back next time we are in that part of town.
author: Ray M.

description:
Fairly sophisticated Indian restaurant located kinda sorta not really by union square. Closer to westfield really.

Anyway, the parking is street only, which means there is no parking. the hilton not quite a block over offers the closest parking, and there is a city garage over on O' Farrell, but like just about anything in San Francisco, you'll be best served by finding a way here that does not involve driving.

From the street it doesn't look like much. It's easy to pass by. Once inside everything changes. Upon entering you'll be greeted with a mural on the left side and the right is pretty much taken up with an old school pattern bar-polished wood, brass railing, wall sized mirror, the works. The bar here looks great, and it's a perfect spot to wait for your table, but this area has some truly epic bars. The bar has the looks, but overall it's not worth any more then a waypoint to the food. Not really a place to get your drink on/hang out is what I'm saying.

The dining room is exquisite. 20 foot ceilings, brick walls, central pillars, white table cloth with vest and tie waitstaff. This is a place to show off for dinner, or to feel pampered a bit. The chef -and yes it is a chef-runs a high performance kitchen. The menu really doesn't have any weaknesses. There really isn't a dish that I think won't be good. There is  not a deep selection-only one variety of chaat, and no dosa-but what is on the menu is mouth wateringly delicious. The house specials are the creation of the chef as is the house specaility wine-madhushaalaa. It's essentially a house made sangria with cinnamon and cardamon. Totally worth it.

About the pricing. You are looking at a 30 to 40 dollar plate, and with two people it's quite easy to get to 50 dollars with add ons-like parantha, naan, drinks etc. So not necessarily a budget place. Still a good choice for an elegant dinner, and they do groups-weddings et al-quite well.
author: Steven W.

description:
We went with another friend's family, total 8 of us. They should not be considered an Indian restaurant. Indian food does not taste like this. The only people who would like food at this restaurant are people who have not tasted authentic Indian food or non-Indians. There is no taste to any of their curries. Everything is so tasteless. They have just given some fancy names to a few curries that are highly priced and horrible taste. 
Never going back.
author: Neena S.

description:
We ordered quite a few dishes for 4 adults and a kid. The veggie started was so terrible not worth   It and the non veg platter was so dry and tasteless .Biryani tasted like curry mixed with rice with every bite having whole spices in them.butter chicken was below mediocre. Navratna korma is supposed to be an exotic veggie curry but turned out to be a watery aloo curry so yuck . Kashmiri pulav was just like plain ghee rice 
, no flavor whatsoever!! Not to forget the portion of each dish was super tiny . Ended up paying $170 dollars for the atrocious food !! What a terrible waste !!
author: Sindhu G.

description: My husband and I love Indian food. The first meal for every new cities we visit has been always Indian curry. We accidentally came across New Delhi restaurant while we stayed in San Francisco and we loved their food. The service was phenomenal. We are moving to San Francisco and this will be our go to a curry restaurant.
author: Ash H.

description: Fabulous food.  Fabulous atmosphere. Excellent staff. This is a must if you're in San Francisco.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Visited last night with a friend and had a lovely meal. I like hot curries so the owner brought me his special spice to add to my sauce and it was hot! Had the mustard lemon fish which was delicious. My friend had the chicken tikka which had a slight kick. We also took our own wine from Napa and paid USD18 corkage. Was a lovely casual dinner and the staff were friendly and attentive.
author: Jayne B.

description: Food was expensive which is fine, but the taste was mediocre and quantity was less compared to the price.
author: Ritesh D.

description: Not horrible. Could find better.  Food was expensive and very mediocre. Would not repeat.
author: Bruce Z.

description:
***Review for DELIVERY only***

Just moved here from DC and this is my new go-to Indian delivery. I've ordered twice through Uber-eats and both times they have been fast and delicious.. as well as reasonably priced. I ordered: Chana Masala, Saag Paneer, Tandori Lamb, Dal Makhani, Chicken Biryani, garlic and regular naan and mango chutney. The only thing I will say is that if you want rice with your meal be sure to order that off the sides menu as it doesn't come with the other dishes.
author: Debra D.

description:
Went for family Dinner on 11/25 Sat.  One of their specialty drinks we ordered in non-alcoholic for a teen, however, they served with alcohol.  For food, we ordered 3 dishes, one of was their house specials. But gave us the wrong dish instead of the house special, which we didn't know until we ate a little bit.  The waitress took it back to the kitchen.  Few mins later...comes back informing us since we ate some of that dish, we will have to pay for it and they can bring it back from the kitchen. Their portion seems small.  So we decided not to re-order their house special.  

Though they made couple of mistakes with our orders, not once the manager came by to discuss with us and they were not busy.  Also be aware of their 18% service charge for 5 or more people.

Food taste is decent but disappointed with their service.
author: Ajay J.

description: Went here with team of 12, beautiful decor. Asked the chef to serve accordingly to his choice and what a blast it was
author: Rifat J.

description: At first we ordered chicken tikka by itself but the waiter recommend us to add it with curry . I was a little skeptical about it but oh was I wrong! It was delicious!!! We also ordered spiced vegetable curry and lamb vindaloo and again we weren't disappointed! I definitely recommend this place! I didn't have any reservations and the place was a little bit empty but please don't let you stop you from trying this place. I also want to add that the customer service was 10/10!
author: J G.

description: Food was delicious with beautiful presentation. Was nice and relaxing atmosphere. Nan & Rice were delicious! It's our 3rd time here.  Each time we try different menu items.
author: Debbie N.

description: The New Delhi restaurant is wonderful. Exceptional dinner with family. Good and service were great.
author: Duncan M.

description:
Great Indian restaurant in Union Square. My coworker recommended this place to me as the best Indian food he's ever had outside of India. 

We ordered the chicken korma, sag paneer, a rice dish, and mango lassi. The rice was good because it had nuts in it. Everything was very tasty and for 2 people, we were very full. The service was very friendly. If you check in on Yelp, you get 50% off your second entree order. 

We came here for lunch on a weekday so there was no wait at all. The space is huge. The owner came by to ask how the food was. The service was attentive, and all the serving dishes were so fancy and pretty - it was like eating for the royalty ;)
author: Jennifer W.

description:
This review is for catering by New Delhi restaurant.  Ranjan and his team catered our wedding this past weekend and we had 0 complaints.  The pricing was very reasonable.  The food was DELICIOUS!  Our wedding guests had so many good things to say about the food.  

So many little things didn't go our way on our wedding day but New delhi's service and food was NOT one of them and we are very thankful for that!

I highly recommend New Delhi's catering if you have an event. 

Thank you so much!
author: Valentina X.

description: Very good food while we visited in San Francisco for my girlfriends birthday trip. Definitely worth trying.
author: Sean M.

description: It was yummy, the chicken tiki masala was good. We went at the end of lunch so it was quiet, food was good- a little expensive for a lunch portion.
author: Tabitha R.

description: This is the best Indian food I've ever had! I've lived all over the world and this is hands-down the most authentic Indian food I have ever had. The service was excellent, the atmosphere was excellent. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an authentic Indian cuisine experience.
author: Benjamen Q.

description:
Since l wrote this original review regarding spam e-mail from this restaurant despite multiple requests to unsubscribe following the unsubscribe link in the body of the advertisement, the chef or restaurant owner contacted me on Yelp and told me to send him an e-mail to be taken off the mailing list. l have done what he advised multiple times over probably close to 10 years, and yet l am still receiving the spam. The proprietor also placed the responsibility on me for receiving spam by saying that the restaurant may not immediately remove 'forwarding e-mail addresses'. l really have no idea what that means, nor is the e-mail address through which l receive the spam a forwarding e-mail address. l followed his advise. Today l received the latest piece of spam from this business.

California Business & Professions Code § 17529.1(l) sets forth:
Commercial e-mail advertisements sent pursuant to the exemption provided for a preexisting or current business relationship shall provide the recipient of the commercial e-mail advertisement with the ability to "opt-out" from receiving further commercial e-mail advertisements by calling a toll-free telephone number or by sending an "unsubscribe" e-mail to the advertiser...

The advertiser here ignores the unsubscribe e-mails and only respond to public Yelp comments. My rights are not respected. Indeed, my rights are violated. It matters not what the proprietor says, l have received 10 years worth of spam despite continuing requests to opt-out.-- an continue to This alone is distressing. For the business to blame me for continued receipt of spam is harassment. This is unacceptable, and l intend to protect myself.
author: Bullitt B.

description:
This place has been one of my favorite places to go to since moving to the Bay Area! Everything is always amazing (food and drinks), the wait staff is kind and attentive, and the owner always treats us like family. 

This IS the place to get the best Indian food in the city.
author: Timandra O.

description:
Ranjan Dey, chef/owner of New Delhi is a master of Indian flavors. Don't let the thin crowd full you. New Delhi is busiest on the weekends, being right in Union Square, but their also the primary Indian wedding caterer in the Bay Area which says a lot about the quality of the food and service. 

I've only had lunch here, but I am looking forward to a dinner with a big group of friends. The restaurant is in a historic building and adjacent to Union Sq. shopping and some fun bars and speakeasys.
author: Nia D.

description:
It's been a long while since I had great Indian food at a restaurant. The Kerala Chicken was awesome. Ambience was very good, very courteous, professional staff, with high EQ.
Post the meal, I had the opportunity of meeting the owner, Chef Ranjan, who came across as a very passionate person. His passion/dedication towards providing authentic Indian food, which also tells a story was super impressive. 
Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting SFO and looking to 'experience great Indian food'.
Ranjan's passion extends to creation of documentaries / writing books, being a great employer and all things culinary! 
In a nutshell, you would just never be disappointed visiting his restaurant!!
author: Shubhodeep B.

description: Ordered food through Eat24. It arrived sooner than scheduled, piping hot and delicious. Nit too oily or spicy. Perfect. Ordered the onion kulcha, saag paneer and lamb curry. All were delicious. Will order again.
author: Sadhna S.

description:
I'm giving this restaurant a one star review for what I consider an inexcusable breach of good restaurant management and customer service. I arrived on a Sunday evening, and while I was seated immediately, other customers who arrived after me were told there would be a 45-minute wait without a reservation, DESPITE the fact that there was entire section of the restaurant that was empty and closed off. If they do not have the staff, hire more staff. But never turn away customers when there is ample space available, just because you cannot manage properly. I know about the 45-minute wait, because I was seated at the front by the register and heard for myself.

Even with the limited tables, my service was poor. The server was slow to come to my table, my water glass was not filled until the end of the meal, and nobody came by to ask me how the food was. And when my dish arrived, there was no accompanying rice. I had to ask for rice, which I've always assumed is a standard side dish with Indian food. That's been the case for every other Indian restaurant I've patronized. I'm a huge rogan josh fan, and the dish I had was not as good as others I've eaten. While the lamb was nicely tender, the sauce lacked a savoriness I've tasted in other rogan josh dishes. The garlic nan was freshly made, but lacked garlic flavor.
author: Dennis M.

description: Excellent place to eat! The food was amazing plus the customer service was top notch. Highly recommended !
author: Magical Mutt Makeovers M.

description:
I came here alone on my first day in to San Francisco looking for something affordable and delicious. To put it bluntly, I left pretty dissatisfied.

Price - $17 for a tiny dish of chicken tikka misala!?  What!?  No wonder they don't list it on the menu! $2 for my order of naan was reasonable but $17 for fairly dry (yes, even though it's bathing in curry) chicken? Never again. 

The food - The chicken is dry and to make matters worse, there isn't that much chicken. I will however admit the curry that the chicken bathes in is quite good. As for the naan, it's wonderful. I love it.

Service - I don't know if it's just because San Francisco is so crowded, or because this place has bad service, but I had to wait painful lengths of time for my check at this place.  Multiple people would pass me by and ask if I wanted to order more food, and I would ask for my check... then they would ignore me. I counted around 20 minutes from the time I was finished with my food, sitting there alone looking sad, until the point I got my check. Then, I had to wait another 5 minutes to get my credit card back. The feeling was quite bad.

Ambiance - It's nice and quiet, and the restaurant is well arranged, but one thing really bothered me.  I was seated under a rotating fan, and above that fan was a light, and thus the lighting around me was kind of like a strobe. It bothered me but wasn't enough for me to ask to be moved.

To summarize - Excellent naan (honestly, I don't know if I've ever had bad naan), excellent curry, mediocre chicken, overly high prices, and awful service.
author: Andrew H.

description: Service is fantastic. The staff was attentive and friendly. The restaurant was ambient and inviting. We had chicken tikka masala and an Okra dish (can't remember the name). The food was really good too but the portion size is ridiculously small! It just doesn't justify the price. I am not a big eater so when I say it is a tiny serving.. it truly is tiny.
author: Eva J.

description: This is the poorest food I ate in United States so far. The worst indian food. If you really dont want to get ripped off with misleading names, skip this one. It is not authentic. We were served burnt papadams with rotten uncooked chicken curry. Our evening was  a total disaster m.
author: Pranay G.

description: OMG!!! Zoe is the best bartender I have seen in San Francisco. Granted she has no server, but she lets her customers that are waiting for service know to order at the bar. Great place for great Indian food, and an awesome place to chill for a drink because of Zoe! Thank you for making my San Francisco experience worthy of travel Zoe. I will tell everybody I know to stop by New Delhi to see Zoe. Burn that ice!
author: Dizzy C.

description: A great meal.  Our chicken dish was very flavorful and the sag paneer was one of the best I have eaten anywhere.   The garlic naan had a bitter taste,  but the overall experience was great.
author: Donn F.

description: Nice, classy ambiance, attentive staff, decent bar, medium quality food. I see that Indian restaurants run by people from different areas of India have differences in food flavors, but please go easy on turmeric. Garlic naan had no garlic flavor and was plastered with turmeric. No one outside of Bengal smothers a naan with turmeric. If I am in the area, I will visit again but will have to alert the waiter to hold the turmeric on the naan. Keep improving!
author: Ramesh K.

description:
Very ordinary food. Seeing the pictures and the description of their food, I had expected better. It was a bit disappointing. Quantity of chutney was a tea spoon! The snack (kind of a fritter with cheese inside) tasted like it had been prepared in advance and then re-heated. That was a bad idea.
Servers were nice and helpful.
Decor was very good.
Ambience was quite nice.
author: Anu B.

description:
Being a huge Indian food fan, I ended up in this New Delhi restaurant in San Francisco. Location is great - close to shopping centers, Bart station, etc. The prices are for about $15 a dish but you have to pay extra for rice.
At the beginning we saw a nice table across from the table we were given (restaurant was half empty) but we were refused to change seats because those are for reservations only. When we mentioned that there are many tables and all of them are available, the waitress then changed her story and explained that that specific area is only for people who know the manager. What...!? That area had like 8 tables at least and only two (with managers friends, I guess) were taken. That's just rude. Well, here goes my first star off.
Next, we didn't see our favorite Butter Chicken dish in a menu, so we asked the waitress which dish is the closest to BC. She said "Chicken Masala". So we ordered Chicken Masala and I also showed her my Yelp coupon for 2nd dish 50% off. She said she does not know about it but she will ask the manager.
Later we ordered Palak Paneer and onion kulcha, still hoping to use my Yelp coupon.
As for Chicken Masala it was far, far from Butter Chicken! Not creamy at all. (We were brought Chicken Tikka later and it was much closer to Butter Chicken - please don't get confused here!)
Chicken Masala was way too runny, I did not like the dark meat instead of white meat.
Chicken Tikka was good. I strongly recommend it. Palak Paneer was the best - my favorite dish. It was the same size as other dishes, so we did not know it's actually an appetizer.
Onion kulcha was okay, I didn't taste or see any onions in it though. I prefer lots of onion in my onion kulcha but this one was just like plain naan.
Another surprise was at the end when we learned that our 2nd chosen dish (Palak Paneer) was not an entree but an appetizer therefore we can not use our Yelp coupon. Well, we wish we were told about it before we ordered it, as I clearly showed my coupon to the waitress.
So the bottom line is that the food is good but little bit pricy for the quality and service. It was not one of the best Indian restaurants I have ever been to, and I have been to so many, including USA, Canada, Nepal, India, Dubai, Singapore, etc. but I would come back for that Palak Paneer.
author: Sanita M.

description:
I was interested in places near Union Square and found this one.  based on reviews was happy to book for LUNCH.  While we were there from noon to about 1 PM on a Wednesday there were ZERO other patrons.  How could this be?  The owner was on premise and explained everything including low lunch crowd - come back at dinner!  It was not "cheap" which probably led to low lunch crowd.  But the food was great!    

now we have to book diner!

lovely décor- we'll be back!
author: Tom M.

description: Food is great and the service is really prompt. Had an amazing dinner with friends and would definitely recommend coming here.
author: ShoAib S.

description:
One of the worst taste of north Indian food in bay area, I ever had. I hope, they never had been to Delhi and won't have idea about Delhi food.

We ordered 4-5 curries and they all were same except different menu names and no taste at all.

Never going anytime back.
author: Pradeep G.

description:
The first time I ever had Indian cuisine was not in a restaurant but at a dear friend's home as her mother shared her recipes and cooking techniques with me. That was my inaugural experience & introduction to South Asian cooking. Over the years, as you might imagine, I have had a very hard time not comparing Indian restaurant food to her cooking! I have tried not to do that but my heart & mind just couldn't help it!

My lunch at New Delhi restaurant yesterday was THE closest I have ever come to experiencing the WONDERFUL flavors of a mother's home cooking wrapped in a genuinely warm welcome! 

The warm welcome came from Chef Ranjan himself, as he led the way to our table and shared with his love for his culture and cuisine! 

Sometimes, the best way to tell if a restaurant is good or great is to order some of the basics! As my friend/colleague said, you can tell good Indian food by their samosas. 

Well, let me tell you THESE samosas are perfect! They are crispy on the outside, piping hot on the inside and when you open them up, a luscious aroma entices your senses to take that first bite full of the flavors of home!

Next the basics again (from the Naan and Sag Paneer to the Tikka Masala) every bite was incredible on the palate! But the most delightful part of this meal was dessert and all you have to do is look at my photos below! 

Thank you again Chef Ranjan for your hospitality! I cannot wait to bring all my family, friends and clients to experience the joys of dining in your restaurant!
author: Carmen M.

description:
It isn't often when you dine out and you leave feeling privileged to have gotten the opportunity to eat there -- and that is exactly how my wife and I felt after dining at New Delhi Restaurant. Chef Ranjan's restaurant is a treasure in the heart of busy Union Square and with all the new restaurants opening up, it was great to eat somewhere that has been successful for 30 years. We loved the look of the restaurant, housed inside a 100 yr old building with exposed brick walls, Corinthian columns, and original Florentine tile. We walked past the beautiful bar and were greeted by a friendly host who escorted us to our table. Chef Ranjan came by to say hello and from there the adventure began!
It's truly special to see and hear from someone who is so passionate about his craft. We started off with cocktails and ordered the Murky Bengali Martini and Ranjan told us about the special Jalpaiguri olives he imports and pickles with his own recipe of spices. They were the biggest olives we have ever seen and drink was balanced and the perfect amount of spiciness. We there ordered some appetizers and entrees - samosa, alu chat croustade, rogan josh (lamb curry), hariyali murg tikka (chicken marinated with mint and cilantro) and a fantastic curry of tamarind and eggplant. Everything was so flavorful, but the highlight for me is when Chef Ranjan asked if I liked spicy food. When I answered yes, he brought by a tiny bit of his special recipe hot sauce which he keeps under lock and key. He talked about the 30+ ingredients (including ghost peppers!) in the sauce and shared his philosophy that there is no point of making something just spicy if it doesn't have flavor. He advised to start off slowly with just a tiny bit on the edge of my fork and to mix it into the curry of the dishes. What an amazing and spicy treat! Even the tiniest bit had a wealth of flavor and really heated things up. We cooled our mouths off with some rice pudding with mango drizzle and some chai tea. 
All in all, it was quite the experience and my wife and I both agreed it was the best Indian meal we've ever had,  not only because of the fresh and flavorful cuisine, but because of Chef Ranjan's hospitality and enthusiasm. It was such a treat and we're so thankful! If you happen to be in downtown SF, this is the place for great Indian food.
author: Will P.

description:
By any Indian standards, the food was badly undercooked and tasted stale. Me and my family walked a distance to get here only to pay for overpriced pathetic tasting food. 
The portion size is extremely small as well. All this coupled with unprofessional servers where you had to wait for 20 mins for your request to get salt !
author: Khushboo M.

description: Watery black dal and tasteless chicken madrass with canned tomatoes. Onion kulcha with turmeric powder, seek kababs uncooked, chicken tikka also uncooked. Only pakoras and pappadum were acceptable, the green chutney had no taste was also watery. Terrible food all around. Will not recommend it.  Service is below standard.
author: Nikhil C.

description: Just went back to New Delhi again last night. I honestly don't know where all the negativity in a few of these reviews come from. The food was delicious! I still consider it the best Indian food in the Bay Area. Service was great as well. I was entertaining friends from out of town and they could not have been happier with the experience. Try it for yourself. You will not be disappointed.
author: Rj P.

description:
Very bad food experience !! We were there late at night and all the other restaurants had waiting so ended up in Delhi restaurant.  Overall don't bother going to this restaurant, they don't serve Indian food.  Menu is written well, no concept of customer service including owner.  We spoke to owner about our bad experience and he said well if you come late that's what you get !!!!

We ordered daal soup, which tasted like sweet gravy of some veg. Was just inedible.  Order paneer chili pakoda, hara bhara kabab, black daal, beg. Pilaf, gujarathi veg., malai kofta and kulchas.  None of the items even tasted good enough ... except black daal.

If you are looking for authentic Indian place, definitely avoid this place.  NOT WORTH IT !!
author: Vishal M.

description:
There are many options for Indian food in this general area, but none are great. After reviewing several places which looked a mess inside we chose New Delhi because it had table cloths and appeared that drinks were available as well as wait service.

The food was very, very average (chicken tikka and rogan josh) and highly priced.  A $17 rogan josh had exactly three (3) small cubes of lamb meat in it.  Are these people nuts?  

Beers were overpriced ($8 for a large, $5 for small). The whole restaurant was full of tourists and very few Indians.

We had to send back some glassware as it was filthy.  Service was quite average.  When a waiter changed the table cloth at the next table my dinner companion nearly passed out from the body odor, haha.  I was quite surprised at his reaction given we had been in a sweaty Pakistani disco the night before.
author: Myron H.

description: Very Poor Customer Service We had to ask every Time when we need something. Also before Closing the Kitchen they don't ask instead their Manager says theres sign out side Restaurant close at 10pm as Courtesy every Restaurant always asks before closing kitchen. I would not suggest any one to go there and west money also food is not great we told them to make it Spicy they made it sweet .
author: Nick S.

description: This is a great place for an Indian meal.  On top of a unique and tasty menu, Chef Ranjan Dey also supports children in the Tenderloin through his charity.
author: Ravi C.

description: Not a good experience. I ordered chicken tikka masala and was confused when the waitress asked if I wanted rice with it... Chicken tikka without rice? The dish was $18 (for chicken and sauce), and I was charged $5 extra for plain white rice... The food was bland and the portions were small. Service was not good either. Worst Indian food I've ever had. I travel a lot and have tried several Indian restaurants. Save your money.
author: Alex A.

description: We ordered starter plater, saag paneer, malai kofta with garlic, butter naan. Plater was disappointing, saag was awesome, and naans are lovable.
author: Venkatesh G.

description:
I love Indian food, so I figured I'd check this place out.  It looks small from the front, but don't be fooled -- it's actually a rather large space.  

The decor is beautiful, especially in the back of the restaurant.  The ceilings are very high and there are beautiful pillars.  I love the use of the vintage copper colored plates.  Definitely worth a look.

I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala w/ rice and Naan -- it was delicious.  The drinks are also very well priced -- I couldn't believe the prices.  

Definitely worth a try!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Great food, horrible horrible service, and tiny portions for what you pay. 

We ordered three plates along with rice and naan and the tikka masala had three small cubes of chicken in the sauce for 15$. 

We asked for another Coke, and they brought it to us after the meal was over. My dad asked for the menu after we had eaten to order some more food, but they never brought it to us!!! 

Here on vacation from LA... I'll stick to Indian food from LA
author: Katerina B.

description:
Ambiance:
Classic, traditional & authentic - loved the vibe as I can't think of any other place in SF that goes "all out" in this respect anymore!

Location:
In the heart of touristy-SF/Union Square, and parking is a logistical nightmare for any place this close to downtown, so it truly is a blessing that this spot's beyond easily BART/MUNI accessible by Powell - either take public transit, walk, or grab a Lyft/Sidecar/Uber.

Reservations:
Available through OpenTable - just make sure there isn't a conference/convention in town nearby as that will inevitably effect the service, out of no fault of the restaurant/mgmt itself.

Food (2 people shared and we had plenty of leftovers)
DRINKS:
- Nimbu pani, sweet lassi, mango lassi & chai; all good but the 'nimbu pani' was my fav!
APPS:
- Chlli cheese pakoras; easily shareable, cooked perfectly crispy outside and not at all saturated in oil as most pakoras can be
MAIN:
- Rogan Josh, Chicken Tikka Masala & Sag Paneer; all so very flavorful, well-portioned, and not overwhelmingly spicy (which is great for me as my taste buds deceive my ethnicity)
- Plain naan & rice; great & nothing was overly dried out as happens often at other places

Pricing:
This is fine-dining Indian food, so, nope, it's not cheap. It's also not your average run-of-the-mill-hole-in-the-wall-health-code-what-health-code eatery at half the prices in most of the TL, but with *very* questionable hygiene practices (slash, lack thereof) -- you get what you pay for here and that's true quality and Chef Ranjan's warm hospitality expertise.

Do yourself and your guests a favor: go all-in for the overall immersive cultural and cuilnary experience here!
author: Anjali V.

description: Terrible food. Flavorless, diluted and unappetizing. Sauces are weak and lack the authentic character of true Indian cuisine. Very disappointing kitchen.
author: David C.

description: Dishes are on the creamy side. I ordered dal soup, kofta Jahani and saag gosht. They look and taste similar. The saag gosht was a disappointment. One does need to order a couple of main dishes, cause one isn't enough. The nan was the only highlight of the evening. I won't be coming back.
author: Christopher N.

description: Great service. One of the best Indian food that I've ever had.. Love the atmosphere, and the people who work there.
author: Parvati R.

description:
It was my first time trying this place last night and it was GREAT! I loved the ambience and decor. We ordered their vegetarian plates with a side of rice and lamb naan. The service was good and I would definitely come back here! 

Highly recommended for all!!
author: Arbie M.

description:
Friendly service.
Good papadums
Curries were good, but not outstanding.
Gulab Jamun was a little too floral tasting for my pallets.
Open quite late and is a good option for Indian food if you are shopping late in Union Square.
author: David T.

description: This was my third time to this restaurant and quickly becoming my favorite.  The place itself is nothing fancy - however its always packed.  And they do a ton of to-go orders. Their Chicken Vindaloo is outstanding - spicy! Samosa - YUMMY! Also, their soups rock.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
Food: Food here is reasonably good.  I had the chicken masala with palao rice and a garlic naan and everything tasted reasonably good.  The sauce in the chicken masala had a tangy kick, which I appreciated.  Being ethnically Indian, I grew up eating Indian food in the household so it's nice to see a different commercial take on common Indian fare.

Service:  Service here was friendly and attentive.  I was able to place my order quickly and settle the bill quickly.
author: Kevin K.

description:
The restaurant was half empty and the waiter still asked us for half hour wait 
We passed by half hour later and the restaurant was still empty. 
Not sure how is food but a lot the attitude was not right.

Sure thanks ..... LOL
author: Manoj S.

description:
This review is only for the bar!

I come here 1-3 nights a week after work to grab a cold one, de-stress, and catch up with some coworkers and let off some steam.

It seems unconventional to go to an Indian restaurant to have shots dance to music, but that's exactly what we do here!
The bar area is quite small, so finding seats can be really tough, especially with 10 of us all getting out of work and bombarding this place so quickly. There are many other 20-30 something year olds here all the time too!

The beer and alcohol selection here is nothing to write home about, but this place has always provided a good time!
Throw a dollar in the juke box and you're bumping throwback music from the 90's, all the way to the brand new releases from last week!

There can be a lot of crazies that harass you for change outside or sometimes even will come in. But they get thrown out very quickly.

Special thanks to Scotty and Sunny for being so awesome and bearing with us every week. You guys rock!
author: Lanie L.

description: We stopped in after the women's march- and though they were busy they found a table for us and our infant. The food was great and they were very accommodating of our daughter who is 9 months and tends to make a mess at the table. A man who I'm assuming was the owner even brought us extra rice for her. Would definitely return!
author: Liz H.

description: New Delhi is one of my fav restaurants in SF and all of SF Bay Area.   The appetizer and entree selections are all amazing and very tasty.    There is a special section with the chef's specialties which I highly recommend - the chicken and lamb dishes are my favorite , but there are lots of great vegetarian selections as well.    There is also a full bar with great alcohol and non alcohol drinks.   I highly recommend a martini.    The ambiance is very nice and the restaurant is right next to Union Square so you can plan a visit with some shopping or ice skating in the winter time.  Last but not least the owner and staff are very courteous and hospitable. If you get a chance make sure to ask for the owner Ranjan and have a chat - if you have a good joke make sure to share that also :)
author: Vinnie C.

description: We come here every year when we are in town. Service is always good and we find the food delicious.
author: Monica H.

description:
We have had a few decent experiences at this place in the past but today's experience wasn't pleasant. 
Service was courteous but supremely slow. 
We had to look and call for someone to come and take the order after sitting there for almost 12-15mins. Food took even longer to come. 
Taste was very average. 
Paneer tikka didn't come with chutneys. 
Portion size was also very small. 
Achari baigan was better than expected.
author: P K.

description: Excellent service and very good food.  We had the lamb curry and eggplant tamarind and both were perfectly spicy and flavorful. We would definitely return to try other dishes.
author: Margaret L.

description:
Awful service. The food was very good when it eventually came, but the wait staff was completely rude and only served us when we came to find them. We waited about 20 minutes before being able to order initially. We only got to order when a member of our party got up to go find our server. When taking our order she was extremely rude and flippant. It took probably another 40 minutes to get the food (including the drinks and water) and that only happened when we once again got up to ask a server where our food was. 

Again, when the food did come, it was great. But so not worth the wait or treatment by the staff. Would not come here again.
author: Kayla I.

description: Had the opportunity to try their food at a roadshow for a Indian real estate firm in San Jose.  Since the 90's I've always passed this place but for some reasons never have tried it, so I was a tad excited to finally have the opportunity do a tasting. As a precursor since this was a catered event I already had lowered my expectations as one has to factor that this is an offsite event. Keeping that in mind everything I tried was a real disappointment.  Lack of flavones and execution on everything. Unfortunately I'll still pass this establishment and not be pulled in to give it a try.
author: Lokesh D.

description:
Love this place and its proximity to Bart! My long-time favorite here is the sag paneer with their nan (and also roti). For drinks we had madras madness and wooo it was strong but refreshingly fruity! 

The service was great, and the restrooms were clean so I can't complain! Will definitely be back for  more food and happy hour deals in the future.
author: Alpo P.

description: My first time eating Indian food was here and I must say that I don't believe I could have found a better place to have this first experience. Ranjan himself made me feel very welcome,  I would encourage anyone to come and try his amazing food. =)
author: Claudia A.

description:
Came here on a Friday night at 1:00am.  Bar was happening. First thing I asked for was a water. 

Bartender looks at me and says "this is a bar". I said "yeah, so?" "You can order a drink or leave".  "Haha, good one. Water, please."  

He gives me an unwelcome look and says "yes I am serious". Told him I was a bartender myself and to go f himself. I've never experienced such a rude experience like that before. 

What crawled up your butt, dude? Never coming back here.
author: Joe S.

description: Really enjoyed the beautiful interior of this restaurant. It had a classic Indian Imperial style with white table cloths and beautiful decorations. The service was lovely and the Eggplant Tamarind was fantastic! Was not crazy about the Paneer Tikka Masala as it was too bland for my taste but I would love to come back and try some of their other dishes. Overall a lovely experience.
author: Karina C.

description: One of the better Indian restaurants I have been to in San Francisco.  Very pleasant staff, very attentive! I had butter chicken this time around and I would order it again. Samosas were delicious and the garlic naan I am craving even now as I'm writing this the following day.
author: Bryan R.

description:
Amazing service, excellent food, made an exception and prepared Jain food.
The owner is very proactive and involved one on one with his customers needs.
author: Tushar P.

description: The food is amazing! Order dangerous curries if you like spicy food. The owner is very charming ask him about his crazy hot sauce he makes!
author: Desirae F.

description:
We've been living in San Francisco for the past 8 years and never tried this place as it's in a touristy spot. I thought I'll give it a try since I had heard good things about Chef Rajan. It was easy to get a table Friday night. The ambience was very authentic. 

The hostess seated us at a round table - perfect for our family of 3 adults and 2 kids. 

It was all downhill from there...

After being seated and settled in for more than 15 minutes and have ordered our drinks, we were asked to move to a different table because they had another reservation for the table we're at. If that was the case, why did they seat us there in the first place. We're moved to a corner table with only 4 seats - very cramped. I later asked the family that was given our table if they had made prior reservation and was told that they did not, and that they had just walked-in. So shady! Given all the trouble we had to go through to change tables again, which is worse if you have a 3-month old to take care of, one would expect to get an apology or at least a complimentary dessert/drink. Silence on both fronts. 

We ordered madras tamarind chicken and chicken tikka masala - which we enjoyed. Naan was ok but paratha was so dry and cold. Rest of the food was just "meh". 

The service here is pathetic.... I would have given 3-4 stars for food, but I'm taking 2 stars off for their service and another star for lying to us about the table reservation...
author: Sachin K.

description: Another of our travel adventure Indian restaurants.  When we decided to go to San Francisco to celebrate my husbands birthday I was soooo excited to go to Naan and Curry again, only to find out they went out of business.  Knowing I wanted to have Indian food, my husband took to the internet to find something that was within walking distance of our hotel.  This certainly fit that bill as it was pretty much across the street.  Our service was good and while I would have to say this wasn't the absolute best Indian meal I have ever had, it was very good.   I had the chicken tikka masala and my husband had lamb vindaloo.  I especially enjoyed the cheese naan. We also had plain naan with the meal and could have used more since we both tend to eat this particular cuisine with our naan much like picking up meats with a tortilla.  We had a reservation, I don't know that we really needed one, but I would rather err on the side of making an unnecessary reservation than being turned away or having to wait for hours on end. All in all a very good experience.
author: Karin H.

description:
Worse experience ever "come on!!! really!!  this is one big scam, the rich are so dumb.  seriously, little itty bitty food with color and whatever fancy Indian spices art bs plating and bs gimmicks, oh its at a heart of the city,who cares, it's stupid mediocre food that's about $5 a bite.  rediculous, where trying to be europeans and we're not, we are  Indians or americans, we want generous portions of quality unpretentious home cooked food."funniest part they did not even offer or asked whether we need something to drink .while the final billing ,curiously I asked them the reason ."answer was "because of California drought they are saving water " f********s . 

Don't recommend
author: Js S.

description:
Before I ordered a lamb curry ($16), I asked the waitress if rice was included, and she said yes. They indeed served rice with the meal. But when I got the bill, it was $21, which had $5 for the rice... I tried to complain, but she said that she couldn't remember what she had said. If this is how they run the business, I will never step my feet on their floor!


Response to Ranjan's comments (12/8/16):

After reading Ranjan's comments, I have to say that what he said is certainly untrue, and I am not sure who told him that story. After I entered the restaurant, I took my time to look at the menu and then decided to order one of the curry entrees with lamb. When I made my order, I asked the waitress if rice was included, and she answered yes. I NEVER ordered "Saffron Badmati Rice"! It was my first time to hear this name when I read Ranjan's comments! 

This is my advice to you: if you really want to improve your business, the best way is to work on your customer service, instead of making up stories to blame your customers.
author: Jing W.

description: Very poor food but a good service. The chef is too bad he uses the same masala for everything. the worst veg pulao i tasted in my life and was really surprised of the quality of basmati rice. so disappointed.
author: Balaje V.

description:
Sat at the bar, enjoyed a Speakeasy tap brew, Lamb Vindaloo (deliciously spicy) and garlic naan. 
Food was authentic and moderately priced. Atmosphere is grandeur and offers a lot of space for larger parties.
author: S J.

description: Nice ambience, decent bar, food took forever to come out and was average. I could live with all of that but the most disappointing part was two little pieces of lamb - and I don't mean chops - I mean smaller than a kebab piece - a very small portion of vegetables and kheer- one naan and a spoon of rice for 30 bucks. This was their non-vegetarian complete dinner. Similar meals at other restaurants in the area have much better portions, quality and service. I won't dine here again.
author: Rickey K.

description: Will be back again and I live 3 1/2 hours away! This was an amazing find. We did the chefs choice and were overly happy with everything. The chef himself came by and explained the dishes. Atmosphere + taste + price = this place is amazing!
author: Sarah G.

description:
The most bland indian food ever. Never again!

This is like Delhi food before India had discovered any spices or salt
author: Karan A.

description: Just got some lunch at New Delhi after a rough morning at work. The lovely waiter brought a much needed smile to my face and better yet, amazing food! If you haven't tried it, get the saag paneer and murgh Akbari. Absolutely incredible
author: Kaitie D.

description: Worst food.  Just expensive and nothing else.  No hospitality. Waste of money.  They didn't care
author: Bhavin U.

description: Wish I would've listened to the reviews, but was too hungry. Actually one of the worst restaurant experiences ever. Food was overpriced, extremely bland, portions were very small. Worst service ever. Waited 20 minutes for water and asked twice for it before we ever got anything. The waitress never came to check on us even.
author: Nellie R.

description: Here look very nice and very comfortable, this is my first  time to come over here, and I'm going to try here's food then bring my best friend who also is Indian come here next time!
author: Alice L.

description:
Over the years, I've attended many of New Delhi's special fundraisers for the event industry and charity events for "Compassionate Chefs". I LOVE, LOVE this quaint restaurant in the heart of San Francisco. It's my go-to place for authentic Indian cuisine. Their assorted vegetable platter, which consists of Samosa, Onion Bhaji, Pakora, Papadum with their Mint and Tamarind Chutney is...Oh so,YUM! 

The Dal soup is my favorite. It has such great flavors and aromas.  My "Go To" platters are the Biriyani, Chicken Tikki Masala, Tandoori Prawns and the Saag Paneer - Outstanding! 

The atmosphere is warm and welcoming. In San Francisco, it's especially a nice treat not to be rushed through dinner service. It's a perfect place to sit and enjoy a conversation or laugh with family, friends and/or business associates. Enjoying their warm Gulab Jamun or Rice Pudding and Chai, is always a perfect ending to a wonderful evening.

Side note - the bar is a great, cozy gathering place for regulars and a great escape from the busy workday. It cracks me up to hear that someone would come to a bar and order "Water" - HELLO - it's a bar! Having a restaurant and bar in SF is costly real estate people; costs are relative!
author: TJ C.

description:
FOUND A ROACH IN MY MANGO LASSI!!!!!!!! 

This place doesn't deserve any stars! The Health inspector needs to be called!!!! 

The hostess was RUDE and didn't welcome us. She walked us to a table, left the menus and walked away. Not once did she smile or say anything. 

Our waiter was polite and took our order. I found a roach in my mango lassi and informed one of the waiters. He went to our waiter and they brought me another drink. I declined and we left!
author: Jenn R.

description:
This place is amazing. The food is thoughtful cooked with the greatest of Indian spices. The menu is vast and they have all the regular traditional Indian dishes. They are willing to change dishes to meet your dietary and religious needs as well. The staff are very attentive to your needs. The Indian themed alcohol beverages are a special treat as most Indian restaurants don't have a full bar.
The location is perfect and parking garage  is in walking distance. And if you get lucky and come a upon Ranjan Dey, the owner, ask him to tell you about his many food tours to India.
author: J E.

description:
Amazing food, service, and ambiance.  Great for events with a large party, a date night, or just a nice dinner out. Don't let any of the negative reviews dismay you - this restaurant is legit and they use quality ingredients while making everything from scratch unlike some of the other Indian restaurants that I've been to. 

FOOD: I highly recommend the SAMOSA to start, the CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, LAMB CURRY, SAAG PANEER, and SALMON.  I also really loved the MANGO LASSI and LEMON SODA DRINK (Indian lemonade - first time I tried it!)  

The staff are all very polite and attentive, making sure our glasses were never empty, clearing empty plates, and boxing up the extras.  

The decor is very well done - feels cozy yet grand at the same time.  There's even an electric fan spinning quietly nearby creating quite a comfortable air-flow.  

The portions were just the right size to try everything and I left the restaurant happy, satisfied, and with a food baby in my belly.  Will definitely be back for more.
author: Jenn L.

description: I went there with my friend and we just loved the food we ordered,it wasn't spicy at all which was disappointing for me but overall I liked the place very much. I'll be back again!  Maybe next time I can get some spicy vindaloo shrimp!,
author: Rachel B.

description:
Was in the area with an out-of-town friend who wanted Indian food. I know there's better Indian food in the dive restaurants nearby, but she likes ambiance so we went here -- my first time in several years.

Same bad experience -- could the waiters be more disinterested? There were only 3 other tables seated so the room was practically empty. But our depleted water and wine glasses were ignored, even as the waiters passed by our table several times without looking at us. They could have made more money by selling us more wine. No one checked in during our meal to see if we were satisfied or needed anything. I really felt as I was being silently told "f**k you" by the wait staff.

Food was ok, nothing notable. High prices for ok food and the worst service ever.
author: Bob J.

description: I have been coming to New Delhi for the better part of six years and I have always, ALWAYS loved the food. This restaurant has always been on of my favorite places to eat. However, I ate lunch here today and I have to admit my experience was really disappointing. The service was great; they refilled our waters without even having to ask and the food order arrived in a timely manner. This review in no way reflects on the servers because they did great. But the food was completely awful. We ordered chicken tikka masala, chicken korma, samosas and garlic naan. The chicken tikka masala was over-salted and practically inedible. I could not taste any masala flavor over the salt. The korma was bland and flavorless. The garlic naan was terrible and nothing like how I remember it. It's usually fluffy and warm with garlic on it. This time the naan had some weird orange spread on it that was salty and hard. My friend was starving and ate most of the food anyway, but I couldn't finish my plate. We both agreed that the food was nothing like we remembered it and we are both sad when we decided we probably won't be back. I'm not sure if the restaurant switched chefs or is using lower quality ingredients but please go back to the way it used to be!
author: Gonee S.

description:
Tried this place tonight for the first time and I'm very happy I did.  Service greeted us right away with a warm smile and took us to a table.  The staff was all smiles and very attentive during the meal.  We picked the usual suspects: samosas, lamb curry, tikka masala, saag paneer (as you can see I will eat it but can't spell it -that's how I like my Indian food) as well as plenty of naan (try the whole wheat!)  We also had some salmon which was very tasty as well.

Unexpectedly, even the rice was good and flavorful which kept me coming back for more.

I really enjoyed this place for both the food and the warm service as well as the ambiance.  It has a relaxing atmosphere with good acoustics so you can hear the people who are talking across the table without yelling at each other, which I always appreciate.

Will definitely be coming back for more, especially with friends in town, etc, as we'll be sure to have another great experience.
author: Jordan H.

description: Very clean , comfortable setting in downtown union square area. Reasonable price, good portion .
author: Wendy D.

description:
We went in and the guy talked rudely. So I didn't feel good about going there. 

Didn't eat anything because of that so can't comment on food.
author: Chetan S.

description: Sorry to say it was disappointing experience tonight. We use to come here a lot and quality of food was good but tonight it was very bad food. Papadum were soggy, onions were uncooked in tadka dal, it tasted chalky. Staff was attentive and courteous.
author: Par M.

description: Not impressed. I was told that this is a hot spot for spice blends from ancient recipes. That we could sample meals eaten by kings and queens of India. Best item was the sangria - strong cinnamon taste and a bit watered down. I doubt the kings drank wine punch. The mixed vegetable dish and black daal was bland. Temperature and timeliness of service was good. Ambiance was nice as well. Food was lacking.
author: Ramya S.

description: The navrattan curry was weak and very sweet. The portions are small as well. As with many San Francisco Indian hotels, rice and bread has to be ordered separate. This makes meal pricier and not a good return on money.
author: Parag W.

description:
I owned an award winning Indian restaurant in Chicago for several years.  I am spending a lot of time in the bay area and stay in Union Square area.  I came across New Delhi a couple of months ago, exploring San Francisco.  The menu was authentic and the ambiance inside reminded me of some of the old palaces that I visited in India when I was a kid.  So a colleague of mine (Italian-American) and I decided to try it several weeks ago and just went to dinner there again tonight.

Both times that we went, we were blown away.  This time, she ordered the Chicken Tikka, Naan and Baigan Bharta (eggplant).  I ordered the Garlic Naan, Roti (wheat bread), Daal (yellow lentils), Chana Masala (garbanzo beans in curry) and Bhingiri Alu (potatoes and mushrooms in curry).  We both got a side order of basmati rice.  The food is outstanding and genuine.  I am frankly, one of the most challenging critics when it comes to food, specifically Indian food, and this is now my go to place in San Francisco for Indian food.  The flavors of each dish were unique and aromatic.

One of the most impressive aspects of our dinner tonight was that we were greeted by the host (Kiran?) and she remembered us from last time.  Now, I know that this place gets very busy and they have literally catered to thousands of people since we last came here, but she remembered us.  What else was really great, is that we just didn't have 1 server, but a whole team of them.  Shortly after we sat down, water right away, then a young gentleman took our order immediately.  The food arrived shortly thereafter.  I was parched, and must have drank 5 glasses of water in a few minutes - the outstanding service delivery aspect of this restaurant is that within seconds, my water glass was continuously being filled.

Ok, now I am going to say something that is potentially going to offend some of my fellow Indian restaurateurs; however, when I typically go to an Indian restaurant and make some special requests regarding how I wish the food to be prepared, I am usually met by a waitstaff that doesn't either care or understand my specific requests.  I was cautiously optimistic that the New Delhi team would cater to my request and waited for my food to test my faith in their team.

They did not disappoint in the least.  I requested no butter on my roti - NO problem - done.  I requested low salt in all my dishes - NO problem - done.  Everything was perfectly seasoned and customized to my requests, that my dining experience was outstanding.  Also, I had so much food left over, that I now have lunch for tomorrow.

The pricing was also very reasonable.  I can't even get a sub from subway for under $4, yet, I can get kickin Garlic Naan here for less.  It is almost criminal on low the Roti is priced at this reputable establishment.  The dishes are also moderately priced - on average, the vegetarian dishes are priced between $9-13 and the meet dishes between $13-16.  For downtown San Francisco, great value for the dining experience.

The best part was, that after the hostess asked us a couple of times how everything was, I informed her that I used to own an Indian restaurant in Chicago and that everything was quite outstanding.  She was very graceful in her polite response and notified the owner, a gentle man, I believe, by the name of (Ranjan?), who came over and conversed with us about our experience and the food.

Just overall outstanding evening!  We will be headed back there soon.
author: Nick K.

description:
Apparently it's an Indian restaurant but they behave as if they are out of this world! The guy who received us was full.of arrogance for no reason as if his guests were beneath him. 
Idiot.
There was a one.hour wait even though restaurant looked like.it could take in ten people. 
We.went.to. a better place instead ! Little Delhi ! Check that out.
author: Shruti S.

description: First time in this place, a party of two. We came in for dinner. Very bad costumer service. Made a reservation and the table wasn't even ready. We didn't got our water that we requested for 40 min after we already gotten and finished our food. The amount of food that was serve is over price. You can't even call that a "meal". The food is good thou just costumer service needs a lot of improvements. I won't recommend anyone going here.
author: Jonah Liza P.

description:
My husband and i love the food at New Delhi! I highly recommend the saag paneer and samosas. The ambiance and service at the restaurant is also excellent. They have a full service bar to hang out in and the restaurant space is large enough for big parties, although parking can be a hassle (typical SF problem). 

What we love the most about New Delhi is their catering service. They catered our wedding in 2014 and we got such great feedback from our family and friends! The food was flavorful with just the right amount of spice!
author: Mo A.

description:
One of the best Indian restaurants I've been to, though I must say I wasn't much of a fan of their onion kulcha.  

Unlike most other Indian establishments the interior is vastly spacious and open with high ceiling which means one doesn't smell like curry after a feast.  They serve the usual masala and tandoori, but also dishes that aren't normally available on other competitors' menus; such as onion rings, Murgh Akbari, and Palak Kofta Kashmiri.  

The staff was friendly and very attentive.
author: J L.

description: The food is spicy and quite good. Everything tasted fresh and made with care. I especially liked the samosas, mango lhasa and tamarind chicken. My complaint is that the price is quite high for what you get. This is more of a special occasion place rather than a quick cheap bite. It has very nice decor and spacious. I surely recommend it for a nice night out. Also, the bar in the front gives a festive feeling. All around it is worth a try.
author: S. G.

description: The food was delicious, but the lunch staff seemed overwhelmed and disorganized. It took quite a long time for the waitress to take our order, longer for the food, and by the time we ate they were closing up for lunch.
author: Jessica B.

description: Good food some unique things on the menu that tasted great. I felt the servers lacked training on allergies but I have been promised that it has been taken care of by their caring owner. I do love the food there, the green veg cutlet was awesome  dont know what it was called. Might take my friends out there for some drinks and snacks.
author: T B.

description:
This place has great location in the heart of San Francisco. The interiors look very posh and elegant and so are the servers. Food itself was so so.

I've ordered Ragan Josh and Tandoori Chicken. The taste was ok, but I know better places for Indian food in San Francisco.

One of the servers was very forgetful and confused my order.
author: Piotr G.

description:
I am half Indian and would consider myself kind of picky when it comes to Indian food. I was blown away by the food and service at New Delhi Restaurant! I had the pleasure of trying several dishes: Chicken Tikka Masala, a lovely lamb dish, rice, garlic naan (wowsers so yummy), a mango lassi, samosas (bite sized delights), and some dipping sauces that were made in house and were the best I have ever had. 

Also, if you like chai tea and want an authentic recipe, this is your place. I highly recommend it! The atmosphere is beautiful and relaxing and there are gorgeous pictures of Indian art on the wall. I also loved the plates that are set out when you first arrive at the table. These gorgeous brass (I think) plates have an elaborate peacock design. 

The owner, Ranjan, is very friendly and full of interesting stories. Say hi to him when you are in the restaurant. Last thing I will say is there is very careful attention paid to each dish and the spice blends used are out of this world. Everything tastes freshly prepared. Definitely check out New Delhi Restaurant first chance you get!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Most pathetic Indian food I have eaten in bay area and trust me I have eaten at many places.

So let me start with most basic north Indian dish..paneer. We ordered paneer tikka masala and the gravy was nothing but orange water with no salt and tasted yuck. The Kali dal practically had no salt and wen asked the waiter he said that it is prepared like that. Ohh as if this is the first time I am eating at an Indian place. Ohh yes and I forgot about the portion size. That is even more bad. 

The servers themselves had different air about them as if they were the owners and didn't like anyone complaining about the food.

I have never written a review because never I have visited a place having low standards in both food and service.

My recommendation is that eat boiled vegetables but don't go to this place even if u have to stay hungry.
author: Vishal V.

description:
I came here on Friday based on the average Yelp reviews, and the fact that I haven't had Indian food in awhile, and was quickly disappointed. My friend and I got seated after we were told that we may not be able to get a seat because we didn't have a reservation. Well, one half of the dining was having a wedding reception, while the other side was pretty much empty.
