Looking at the menu, it was a little on the pricey side, and all you got was the entree. Any other sides, you had to order separately. I ordered the Paneer Tikka, which was really a tandoori, a side of cheese naan, and one of their cocktails that was listed as being a stolen recipe on their menu. I was pretty surprised at how cheap their cocktails were. Well, when I got my drink, I could see why. Pretty small. My friend order the prawn tikka masala and a side of rice. My dish cost $12.95 and I think my friend's was $14.95.

We get our food and we're both surprised at how small the portions were. My friend's curry had no heat at all, but had some flavor. My paneer was okay. It was very dry though and was just laying on a bed of raw veggies that cooked on the pan the paneer came out on. The highlight of the whole meal was the naan and the check, which took a very long time to get. What made the whole experience, slightly better, was a 50% off an entree by checking in on Yelp.

Save your money and disappoint for another day and just go to Blondie's.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Best most authenticate curry! Coming from a Brit who misses his London Curries!!
Heat is right, quality and quantity are spot on! Check out the chicken and mushroom Madras! It's not on the menu, I just asked for it ;) This is my 3rd time here and I live near Boston! This is better than the 4 Star places detailed above! 4 poppodoms for starters, works for me! Don't forget the "Kingfisher!"
author: Tony P.

description: Ordinary. Nice setting. Bland food, which is hard to do with Indian cuisine. Inattentive waiters. Nan tasted bad. $30 for special + beer + Nan.
author: T R.

description:
Great fresh food. The owner came over and was super nice!
Portions could have been bigger but I'd definitely come back!
author: Chris M.

description: Horrible service & stale food. Worst Indian food. Tikka dry, nan made in afternoon from buffet. Rice old. Charged for Chutney. No water wait staff clueless. Stay away!
author: Lisa R.

description:
So much of warmth in this place..Do try the dum maro dum alloo here..Perfect blend of spices..love the place..love the masala chai too!
The Friendly welcome by Chef Ranjan Dey is a cherry on cake..One of the finest Indian Restaurant i have tried till now in the bay area! A big thumbs up
author: Tanya A.

description:
food was great 
spices were balanced 
paneer sabji and butter chicken
didn't like the bhindi tho  

service was oki oki
author: Ruby P.

description: This is the worst restaurant, I have gone to. I am have been to some bad restaurants but never this bad in my life. The service was unacceptable to both me and all of the other customers. My group called up and had a reservation, but they didn't inform us that there was dress rehearsal for a future  wedding. So we arrived and ordered and waited a 100 minutes just for them to forget a part of our order. And it would make sense for the food to be good because it was so many people were there.  But neither the food or portion was satisfactory. They only way people were able to bear the wait was the fact that they gave tiny appetizers and keep people in the restaurant. We were not the only ones who hated the restaurant, almost everyone was mad at the terrible service. However, I cannot blame the servers, I can only blame the manager for his terrible managing. Please do me a very big favor and never go to this pathetic excuse for a restaurant. I would give this place a zero star, but I cannot do that.
author: Rahul G.

description: Worst Chicken biryani Ever! Way overpriced for $21.75 just for the shitty biryani. This was my first and the last time here. If you guys wanna have good biryani then go to next restaurant Chat corner or Punjab(which is a block from this restaurant). There price is half of what they charge and food is 10 times better than this restaurant. Plus! Service is way better. New Delhi is a rip off with shitty quality food.
author: Anish G.

description: This place is all time favorite! Nice ambiance, nice people and best food ever had! (: Should give it a shot especially the chicken soup, veggie pakora and butter lamb!!!!
author: Fatima L.

description:
Great service, our server was very nice and completely appropriate. However food is a different story. The description of the dishes as written on the menu have very little to do with the quality of the cooking and the resultant taste of the food. $ 19 biriyani was the smallest amount of biriyani ever served in any Indian restaurant. Personally I like smaller portions but it should be well cooked quality food. The rice in the biriyani
(a rice based dish) was undercooked, the raita was thinned out. 
Next the cauliflower in mustard sauce .. not sure where the mustard went. For $15 that's the smallest amount of cauliflower curry ever served to me in an Indian restaurant. Again cauliflower the main ingredient was undercooked and they forgot to salt the dish. Achar boti kabab followed the same trend of poor tasting overpriced food and the salt they forgot to put in the cauliflower was added to this lamb dish. Chewy lamb pieces served in a platter and the only sizzling thing about the platter was the metal platter itself. Also none of the prices included rice or bread which has to be ordered separately and bread was again of inferior quality than in most Indian restaurant.

 We eat out in nice restaurants of all different ethnic variety as we love good food and because we are of Indian origin we cook Indian food and have eaten in many Indian restaurants all over united states. We had eaten several times in Rasika Indian restaurant in Washington DC area ( very upscale well known Indian restaurant ) and they have higher price range than most Indian restaurants. However each and every time they serve great quality, well cooked, Indian meal that makes every Indian proud. I have no problem paying well as long as the food served is good quality well cooked dishes that tastes well.

My advise to anybody looking up Indian restaurant in SF area, please avoid this place. Plenty other options available in this area and in a years of experience with Indian restaurant you will get a better value in any other place. 

 I will again say our server was very nice and helpful and the restaurant was clean and tastefully decorated. We sort of wondered into this restaurant tonight without looking up in yelp first( like I almost always do) and initially looking at the decor and service, we were planning to come back again this week with more family. Off course we changed any such plan and felt compelled to log onto yelp to post this review. As an Indian woman who is a good cook and a better food connoisseur I am ending this review reiterating my advise, please try any other Indian restaurant in the area and you will be getting a better value for your money.
author: Subhasish R.

description:
After eating at Little Delhi numerous times, we decided to give this place a try.  I didn't expect to see a bar right in the front, but we passed that by and were shown to our table.  

There were beautiful copper plates with a peacock design on the table.  I looked forward to eating off one...until they took them away and replaced them with regular ceramic plates.

We had the Chicken Tikka, Bombay Saffron Bhuna Lamb, Onion Kulcha, and Tandoori Roti.  The lamb was good but not great, I was hoping for more.  The chicken was good.  I was hoping to pick burnt pieces of onion off the plate like when I order fajitas, but they weren't blackened.  The bread was good too.

The portion size was a little smaller than I am used to, especially given the price.  Given how clean the restaurant itself was, the restroom was really dirty.  It had a strong urine smell, and I wondered when it was last cleaned.
author: The Bottomless Pi T.

description: I placed an order for Paneer Tikka masala.This was a recommended dish by the staff working at this restaurant.I combined this dish with garlic naan.Excellent food the spice was just perfect and the paneer was pretty soft. I would like to come back again to explore some more options on the menu
author: Kanica P.

description:
Awful food... My friend drink had a fly sitting  right on top..

Do your self a favor and walk-in to an indian grocery store and get the packed lunch packs for $1.99- cauz those are far better in taste and quantity compare to their food..

The food is not even worth few cents to spend on them. Do yourself a favor and go to any other restaurant in sf, but not this one.
author: Ali A.

description:
Restaurant: The food AND service are so exceptional here that we have become regulars. We have eaten at many other Indian restaurants in the Bay Area and  can say nothing else really compares. Chief Ranjan has a stellar culinary background and the quality of his food is that of a Michelin restaurant.

Wedding Banquet Catering: We wouldn't have considered anyone else. The presentation, blend of flavors, temperature were all perfect, and we received many compliments from our guests. Chief Ranjan even created an Indochinese menu to accomdate our Chinese and Indian guests. We are always so well taken care of at New Dehli.  ( They also have an amazing showcase of wedding vendors every year and they are talented. Fantastic event.)
author: Bay Area Yelper S.

description:
Poor service, lack luster flavor. Boring and bland. Over priced for not so hot food.

Service was incredibly slow
author: Ted T.

description: Outstanding! Can't even begin to describe how delectable each dish was. What a find. Beautiful restaurant great service. Finally a place were the waiters actually know how to serve.
author: Ronda H.

description:
Had to write the review. SO MAD!! Went there yesterday with 2 friends for lunch.
Ended up here instead of Little Delhi as we had originally planned.  There was just one old white guy sitting there when we reched at 11:40. First we were told it opens in another 15-20 mins but then were seated. The decor is beautiful. But WORST FOOD EVER !! Maybe they should start paying attention to their cooking instead of the decor. Nothing was good. We had the tandoori platter (no salt), tamarind chicken (dry chicken even though it's a gravy dish) and chicken biryani (dry chicken + non-basmati rice). I have never had such horrible food after paying such outrageous prices. My friends were of the same opinion as well. NEVER AGAIN!!
author: Mili A.

description:
Ordered the Chicken Tikka and cheese + regular naan and it was excellent. The staff was very friendly, checking on us multiple times to make sure the food was as expected, our water full, if we needed anything else etc. Our waitress, Kiran, was very sweet and accommodating and helped us pick out what she thought were the best dishes on the menu.
Ordered the gulab jamun and rice pudding for dessert and was some of the best I've had.
Check them out and don't let all these bad yelp reviews steer you away, this place has great ambiance, great customer service, and most importantly, delicious food.
author: Carter F.

description: A group of us visited last week so I got the chance to try a variety of dishes. With the exception of one, all were bland, tasteless and of a similarly uniform brown. Even typically vibrant Mutter Paneer was a thin, soupy concoction in the same duff color. Service was indifferent, check was expensive considering the lack of quality offerings.
author: Philip B.

description: One star would be generous... Coming from England where curry is a national institution, this place is one to avoid. Please save yourselves and try somewhere else. The Thai up the street (House of Siam) is amazing. Little Delhi is a BIG miss.
author: Matt B.

description:
I love Indian food, and little Delhi (not to be confused with new delhi) was a favorite spot for me and my former boss to go; so when I was leaving, Indian was the natural choice and instead of little Delhi we decided to shake things up a bit

Boy, that was wrong

The curry portion was small, not flavorful, and not spicy at all, even though I asked for extra, extra extraaaaaa spicy..not even a pop of hot

Some of the other orders weren't done correctly, the chicken pieces in it was nonexistent

And the price is about three times what I would have paid at little Delhi.

The interior is pretty, but the food isn't good, you're better off at naan and curry and if you've read my review for that, you'd know

Do yourself a favor, cross the block diagonal and visit little Delhi.  The food there is 10x better, better priced and, if you ask, they will accommodate and actually make your curry spicy
author: Whitne Y.

description: I eat a ton of Indian food, and this is the best Indian food I've ever had. The 7 Gems Curry was insanely good, and the lychee and mango martinis were excellent. And the lamb sausage was AMAZING!!! The owner Ranjan is wonderful and kept us entertained with conversation and jokes throughout our meal. I can't believe I'd never heard of this place before. I'm going back all the time; this is now my only Indian restaurant in the city. Love love love!!!!
author: Kristin A.

description: Very friendly bartenders, I love the fact they carry 21st Amendment Blk IPA on draft. Very mixed crowd, sf melting pot.
author: Séamus C.

description: Ambience is very make believe, food is decent and pretty good.service is good as well. All in all good for family and friends.
author: Nicholas K.

description:
New Delhi gets four stars just for having ghost chili sauce.  Just so you understand how excited I am/was, let me repeat:  GHOST CHILI.  Got it?  Good.  

I'm not sure that is on the menu, but when requested, they provide.  Well, it was not actually requested.  It was more of me asking for lamb vindaloo "Indian spicy" and the server laughing at me.  So, the manager comes out and asks for the person who requested Indian spicy.  I tepidly raise my hand.  He told me they would give us a little bit of ghost chili sauce in a bowl, and just to dip the tines of the fork quickly in the sauce, then mix with other sauces.  I think most people in my group tried the sauce, which made me proud.  It was extremely spicy, and the spiciness definitely lingers, but I loved every second of it.

Onto the food - a group of 8 of us split papadum, samosas, naan, lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, eggplant masala, chicken biryani, saag paneer, chicken madras, and a coconut curry dish.  Papadum, samosas, and naan were all tasty.  I like the lamb vindaloo, and it was very spicy, even without ghost chili sauce.  Lamb was tender.  I tried the chicken tikka masala, and thought the chicken was a bit dry.  The curry dish was great, I wish I could remember the name.  We also ordered two bottles of wine - one red, one white.  I forget what the white was, but I definitely liked it.  Needless to say, we did not finish all of the food.
author: Lia M.

description: Came here a few years ago with a friend and remember having very good Indian food. The chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken was mouthwatering. I recently took my bf here because we happen to be shopping around Union square. Let me say the food was excellent as I remember. My bf loved it. If you are coming here for excellent customer service then you came to the wrong place. Let's just say the food makes up for the poor service. I think our waiter forgot my mango lassi! At least they kept refilling our water. Good food? Yes! Good service? Sorry not today!
author: Lily V.

description: This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in the Bay Area. The warm ambiance and  the decor is very unique, elegant and upscale. There is always a warm greeting by the host when you step into the restaurant. Their service and staff are exceptional and very attentive. Their Indian cuisine selections is very authentic and delicious. The owner sometimes come over to greet the guests and see how they are doing. This is very personable. I highly recommended this place to anyone who enjoys amazing Indian food.
author: Huong N.

description: Just had the Pakora, Tandoori platter, Chicken Masala and Saag paneer w/ mango lassi and chai tea. The Pakora was the lightest I've ever had and everything tasted so fresh. A nice change to the typical buffet style Indian restaurants. Come eat and meet celebrity Chef Ranjan this Thursday at this event. http://eepurl.com/bN7acb.
author: Tedp N.

description:
Service: ok and not great worth what I ended up paying. it was cold and waiters made us wait so much. 
Food: I can cook better! menu is just simply hyped up.. I was expecting best of bestest kind of food and I got food that I could cook when my own spices have run out and am completely drunk.

Quantity: man, I've never been to any restaurants that robs like this! I have always been served with entrees that I can't finish (I eat less), but here the quantity was so less that I stopped by a burger joint to fill up.. 

Verdict: Indians or people who have eaten Indian food like everyday would not like it.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
Horrible food. 
One of the worst Indian places I've been to in the US. I thought, being in San Francisco, this place would have high standards and excellent food. However, the food was even far from ordinary. 
The quantities of both appetizers and the main course was laughable. The food was absolutely bland. This kind if food was so bland, it wasn't even fit to be served in hospitals and is a disgrace to traditional Indian cuisine. Like one of the other reviewers has said, the menu is totally hyped up and makes you go wow. However, the menu is all talk and no action. The food would be far better if they cooked to even 1% of the description given in the menu. And above all, it is priced outrageously. Avoid this place at all costs.
author: Tuhin S.

description:
The place seems nice at a first glance, he dishes taste not good, and the price is relatively high. They don't even have chicken tikka masala in the menu.
The worst thing is that the service is TERRIBLE. We had really extremely bad experience in this restaurant, will never go there again.
author: Susan Z.

description:
worst food ever. I was visiting SFO with family members. After having a ride on cable cars, we found this restaurent on  yelp nearby and decided to try.first we orderrd dal tadka  and paneer. Dal  came with no tadka, and tastes like boiled dal with no salt and chilli. the quantity was very little. SO we orderd mutter panner. This mutter paneer exactly tasted like the "Ready to Eat from MTR". it was horrible. 

Guys seating on next table had the same experience. We had to return that paneer curry.

dont go to this restaurant. try something else.
author: Sandip B.

description: We've been going to Little Delhi for a long time but decided to check out this place. The atmosphere and ambience is nice here. Staff is very friendly and trying very hard to make a good experience for you and provide excellent customer service (this 4 stars). The food was good too but pricey for the amount. LD gives you more food for less.
author: Tatiana G.

description:
Pleasant setting, albeit culturally confused, as with the half-Ionic-half-Corinthian columns or the sitar version of "baby light my fire". LMAO.

Good food and reasonable prices - where else can you still get a decent wine by the glass for $5?

I had the non-vegetarian chef's tasting menu and loved it, although I'll probably wake up hungry in the middle of the night because it reads more filling than it is. Still, recommended place for an authentic, tranquil experience...
author: Marco S.

description: I recently had the pleasure of dining here for the first time. I'm a huge fan of Indian food, and can't believe it took me so long to venture inside. With all of the hole in the wall Indian eateries in San Francisco, it's a welcome treat to dine at an upscale establishment with a full bar and wait staff. The food and drinks were excellent. The dishes were delicious and perfectly spiced. The cocktail program was creative, giving an Indian kick to classic cocktail fare. I loved viewing the photos of all the notable past diners and the opportunity to meet the gracious and animated owner himself. I'm making this one of my regular dining venues!
author: christine r.

description:
I won't return or ever recommend this place. I think the treatment our group received, got yelp at least 10 new users.

We show up (with a large group, I'll grant) and they seem ok with seating us, putting together a long table. Another group with an equally long table was right beside us, so...

(Backstory) my friend bought us some margaritas while we waited and we brought them to our seats.

The waiter comes by and suggests we give him a per person budget and he'l just whip up a little of everything. A few members of our group didn't like that idea and wanted to order individually. Probably the wrong choice.

He comes and takes our orders no big deal. Then he comes back and says, since we all ordered individually it'd take longer to get our food and it'd come out whenever it was ready. Uh...

Then he asks if we wanted some appetizers. I suggested just several baskets of naan, "No that's not a good idea" uh...

so he brings out mini samosa and pequora. They were all right, very mini but ok.

The first few plates start coming out and my friend asks if we can order some beers since we've long since finished our margaritas. "No you'll have to wait until all the food is out."

Thankfully someone else heard or something, another waiter came and took our order for beers.

The food all drives and other than some garlic naan vs. regular mix ups was all good. Even quite tasty.

Then a few of the staff come and seem to be taking a tally of the table.

Then the bills come. All individualized, which is kinda nice.

Except: Mine had "top Chef" and 2 beers. The marts were paid in cash at the bar and I only had 1 beer. My friend had "Top Chef and 1 beer (before you think they simply mis appropriated his)

Each of us, 20 strong, was charged $5 for appetizers.

After calling the waiter over a few times to remove erroneous items from the bill it was a $50 meal for most of us at the table. LAME.

I understand big groups are hard, and I suspect seeing that we were attending a conference they weren't concerned with repeat business, but still. I've never had that crappy of service. There's plenty of indian places to choose from in San Francisco, don't choose this one.
author: john W.

description: So i was with my family we where in San Fransisco and decided to eat some great indian food i checked New Delhi Indian website which looked great in pictures the look and field they presented and images they uploaded on website convinced me to go there with my  family. We skipped lunch so we can eat there. We ordered the two most expensive dishes $17.00 each  not even worth worst ever i tasted, then i ordered garbanzo beans( Channa Masala) was not even cooked properly smelled bad it was like they warmed up those frozen packet. I will never go back they are not worth you will be much better eating somewhere else. Don't go for the ambiance worst quality and over priced food. Save money and time eat some place else.
author: Sam S.

description:
After being spoiled at home with my Mother's cooking (spent few years in Delhi, Mumbai and Bengaluru). I found an affordable, warm and great Indian restaurant near Union Square. Highly recommended to all. They do have some options that are not so hot. But is definitely worth it. 
Service is not the brightest bunch but the do their job kindly. 
Will be back!
author: Tomas C.

description: Worst food ever i had. Worst customer service. The owner is so rude. Suggest everyone not to go. No good ambiance.
author: Kinjal S.

description: Called to make a dinner reservation, we were told it's not necessary and just come in. We came in at 8:30pm and we were told they can't take us in as they are full and we had no reservation! Messed up system, they should consider more training or closing.
author: Jen F.

description: I've been to New Delhi 4 or 5 times - liked the food and the room. But last night went with friends (5 of us) and had big problem. I looked over the bill, but didn't pay too much attention. When the credit card slip arrived, it showed the "PRE-TIP AMOUNT" so I added 20% and signed. Fortunately the ladies needed a restroom break and I started to think the bill was higher than expected. I asked for the original check and when they brought it I saw that they had added 18% service between my approval and the credit card machine. I demanded and got a refund on those charges and certainly left zero tip for these clowns. Although they expressed confusion, I believe the error was intentional. We won't be back.
author: Bill R.

description:
The New Delhi is an elegant restaurant with high ceilings, imported Italian tiles on the floor,  and decorative columns - one would not guess from looking at the establishment from the sidewalk that it is bigger inside,  To dine on excellent Indian food, go past the bar area at the front door .  

The handmade naan bread comes fresh out of the tandoori oven.  
Very delicious dishes were the Paneer Mukhani (homemade cubes of cheese in a rich tomato cream sauce), Murg Akbari (chicken in mild spices), and Karahai Gosht (lamb curry).

Chef and owner Ranjan Dey is a gem (hospitable, knowledgeable, with a great sense of humor) who has a wealth of international and San Francisco experience.  

Service was excellent.  

In general, it was a wonderful experience

I have not dined on Indian food very often, but this visit makes me want to return.
author: E h.

description:
Awful food. Ordered baigan masala, it was not cooked properly. It was raw onions and tomato. Lamb kofta, was very dry in some cream sauce. Pretty pricy for the quality and quantity of the food. Naan was ok. Also had ordered madras drink ( can't remember the proper name ) with mango pulp. Ended up with upset stomach. 
Service was ok.
author: G S.

description: Hardest lamb boti kebab. Sour cocktail. Mediocre salmon fish curry. Not worth the price at all. Traditional ambience is the only thing good about this place
author: T V.

description:
This review is just for the bar. 

I did not get a chance to dine here, but my guy friend and I were looking for a place to have a few drinks and make idle chit chat.

Four beers later, we're talking about philosophy, outer space, science, the past, present, and future. Our conversation got a little "out there", which can happen when you have a few. 

I don't know how to flirt, but I was attempting to, rather clumsily. We were both yawning by 10pm since we both work early morning shifts, so we said our goodbyes around then. 

The bartender was pleasant and left us alone besides our refills, which I appreciated. The ambiance is really charming. I loved the pilars and warm lighting, and it smelled fantastic. 

I felt like it was slightly pricey, but $6 for a pint of beer is pretty standard, I suppose.
author: Brandi W.

description:
I've been to New Delhi Restaurant at least ten times - this review focuses mostly on the last time I went in June 2013.

I ordered appetizers to share with friends - we sat at the front of the restaurant, in the alcove near the bar. It was the perfect spot for the six of us who had come - we were able to enjoy great conversation while sipping drinks from the bar. In addition to fun creative cocktails like the Madras Madness rum, mango and grenadine drink I had, they serve non alcohol drinks like mango lassis (sweet or salty) and nimbu pani.

For appetizers:
- Vegetable pakoras (fried vegetables, these are my absolute favorite)
- Mini vegetable samosas (a smaller version of the larger samosas, these little treats had a kick. Careful, they're hot!)
- Hariyali tikka (chicken with a spice. Yum.)

Dinner was excellent, we ordered: 
- Regular naan (savory, just the right texture of chewy)
- Rogan josh (spiced tomato based curry with lamb, with a kick)
- Saag paneer (on the sweet side, but still amazing with a generous amount of paneer chunks)

The food is delicious - wonderful flavors, always made to the spice level as requested. The ambiance inside is regal - tall ceilings, fancy decor - it feels like being in an Indian palace.

Every time I come, I feel nourished and relaxed. It's one of the places I'm happy to say that I'm a regular.

Additionally, I've gotten to know the owner Ranjan - in addition to the restaurant, he does amazing things with his culinary expertise, like the trip he is planning with patrons eager to taste more of India - with a trip there.

He also started the Compassionate Chefs Cafe, a non-profit organization dedicated to raising money to help children "locally and globally." How many restaurant owners do you know who also have non-profits?? Pretty cool.
author: Jen B.

description: Ranjan and his team catered our wedding. The food was delicious and the service was phenomenal. Ranjan treated us like royalty at our tasting and came up with a delicious menu. Both our Midwestern and our Indian guests complimented the food, which is pretty amazing. Ranjan told us he had catered hundreds of wedding in SF and his experience really shined through. I thought we would have had to pay a lot more to get such experience and high quality food, but the prices were very reasonable and actually less than other Indian caterer we got a bid from.
author: Kate S.

description:
I ordered 2 tandoori rotis, 1 plain nan and 1 mutter paneer. The waiter didn't tell me that I've ordered too much. I didn't know their portion size and didn't know that I'd ordered too much till the food arrived. Maybe it's my fault, but there was just 1 other person in the restaurant at that time, so I guess I could've got a little more attention.

The food was ok. Not great, but not bad. I felt that it was too bland for my liking, and the peas in the mutter paneer were probably added towards the end as they didn't have any taste.

Overall, I would recommend this place if you need to go somewhere a little classy, and if you've got a sensitive tummy.
author: Ridhish G.

description: Slow, rude service, and took 40 mins to get our drinks and food. Delicious curry, but I would't come here again.
author: Andrea R.

description:
New Delhi & Ranjan was highly recommended from a top hotel in the city for our indian + American mixed wedding in June. We couldn't be happier that we went with New Delhi for our catering. We had their food for our mehndi party/ sangeet and our half and half wedding the next day.  Ranjan and his team were very attentive to the fact that the majority of guests would be unfamiliar with Indian food -so they made the food fun, finger food friendly, but not overly spicy or heavy/drippy.  It was perfect and everyone loved the creativity.

Ranjan was easy to work with, flexible, a great listener, and very professional.

Oh- and if you go to the restaurant get one of their speciality cocktails! delish!
author: Angelica M.

description:
If you happen to be in the area and say "I'd like to have some Indian food for dinner," do yourself a favor and head to Little Dehli, which is about 2 blocks away.  

The food isn't bad, it's more "eh - nothing to write home about, but at these prices it's ridiculous"  To illustrate the point - the garlic naan didn't have any minced garlic on it.  Instead, there was garlic powder.

To round out the terrible experience, you can expect slow and nonattentive service.
author: Larry L.

description: Food was good, but servers were rude. We ordered a coke, and when we asked for a refill, we were told that they don't do any refills. I found this shocking as they had served us from the fountain in a pretty small glass, and they dont have the option of ordering a bottle or can of coke.
author: Nikita J.

description:
Great ambiance, good Indian food, fantastic service! Get the chicken korma!  Ok, most of the Indian restaurants in SF are in places where the restaurant's sanitation is highly questionable (a la Naan N Curry).  I was looking for an Indian restaurant to get my curry fix without a stomach virus the next day.  This is the spot.

Food:
Typical Indian fare.  Not as tasty as Naan N Curry or Shalimar, but hey, at least it tastes clean haha!

Service:
Seems like a family owned place.  The owner came out and greeted everyone warmly.  

Ambiance:  Great for dates and a place to talk, just skip on the garlic Naan if you're gonna be talking up close and personal tho!

Pricier than its counterparts, but that's the price of clean Indian food in SF I guess.
author: Carlo S.

description:
Food: I asked for non-spicy and I got very spicy.  I asked if they can avoid a certain ingredient due to an allergy, they said that their food is pre-made and they can't remove any ingredients.  Therefore, I had to choose a different meal.  

Drinks: they have Indian beers and a few specialty cocktails.  You can't go wrong with Indian beer if you enjoy that taste.  The cocktails that our table ordered were not good by any means.  They definitely need to look at their options and reconsider the drinks.

The best part of the night was the table next to us with 2 Swedish couples that were so drunk, loud and just pure entertainment.
author: Nora F.

description:
I'm always skeptical about the authenticity of ethnic restaurants in touristy areas. Given that New Delhi Indian Restaurant is just 1 block from the Union Square madness means it's a pretty big red flag for me. However, I was recently here on a business dinner with some out of town co-workers who love Indian food, and the restaurant didn't disappoint. Most of the dishes ordered seemed to be very flavorful and had spice (usually restaurants wimp out on the spice because they think people can't handle it). That was a refreshing surprise!

We ordered the mixed vegetable pakoras, papadum, and samosas as appetizers. All were solid, and a really great way to begin an Indian meal. For the main dish, I chose to go with one of the Ranjan's Specials, namely the spicy madras tamarind chicken. Being a huge fan of tamarind and never seeing such a dish on a standard menu at Indian restaurants, this was a no brainer! It was delicious!! More on the sweet side than the tangy side, so it was an explosion of flavor for the tastebuds. Loved every bite of it. The others ordered a variety of chicken, lamb, and seafood curries, as well.

What I noticed was that the restaurant does not cheap out on the quantity of meat in curries. Usually you go to an Indian restaurant and they've got about 4 pieces of meat incorporated into a whole dish of curry and charge you about $12 or so for it. The dishes here were averaging about $15, but the amount of meat in the curries was fantastic! None of us finished any of the curries, because everything was so plentiful!

The one downside to the meal: The naan was slightly more doughy than I expect.

I'd still come back here and bring out-of-towners looking for good Indian food.

P.S. Not sure why the other reviews are so low commenting about the bland nature of the food. Being Indian, I know my spices, and this food was most definitely NOT bland.
author: Mansi A.

description:
The fiance and I ended up here by accident, we were headed to another restaurant two blocks up, it was darky, windy, and rainy... we saw the sign and ducked in, best duck-into-for-shelter-place ever!
We started with Mango Lassi's, and Veggie Samosas - both very good!
For our mains we had Bombay Soya Nuggets and Veggie Kofta along with naan.. Admittedly, we both wanted to lick the bowls clean. But we didn't. Promise. We'll be back for sure, can't wait to try more off of their menu!
The hostess and servers were all very nice and attentive :)
author: Paula S.

description:
My two expereinces at New Delhi were a dream!!

As a venue coodinator I had the amazing opportunity to sit and dine with Ranjan to learn more about Indian culture and how to make sure The Regency Center is able to accomodate Indian weddings. Ranjan took the time to create a one sheet of details including the many religions, Mandap ceremonies and even taught us a few Indian phrases. Ranjan is versed in catering in San Francisco which is not an easy job. New Delhi has been added to our preferred vendors list and I cannot wait to host our next Indian Wedding! I am confident that I can trust New Delhi to be able to work within the limitations of The Regency Center, which does not have a working kitchen.  

After our education session we were treated to a full feast including two speciality cocktails.  I could not be more impressed.  The food was full of flavor and served in beautiful flatware.  Ranjan pulled out the red carpet for us and I can't wait to go back!
author: Bailey N.

description: One of my favorite Indian restaurants in the city. It has an air of regal elegance inside, while the decor and menu are full of historical references that makes the restaurant feel special. The staff is always incredibly attentive and polite. The food is fantastic. My only wish is that they develop a lunch menu with lower lunch prices. You're competing against hundreds of spots in the area during that time and few lunch specials could go a long way towards staying busy on a regular basis for lunch.
author: Sir Madam C.

description: Absolutely terrible food and equally bad service!! First day in SF.. Looked at hotel mags, city guides, open table and decided to get in and that was the biggest mistake. Ordered veg platter for appetizer which had everything stale.. Papadum is the basic side dish which adds crunch to the food.. It's not rocket science to cook this one.. Steady made papad which has to be fried!! This one was so stale that I could say without eating it. Chicken masala.. Dry chicken, no coriander or fenugreek leaves, uncooked gravy and I can go on and on.. Chicken biryani was pathetic to say the least.. For 19 bucks it's complete rip off.. Our local hole in the wall restaurant does better job. And raita was sweet!!! Positively worst Indian restaurant we have dined at.
author: Natasha G.

description:
We went here as a group because one of us wanted to try ghost chili sauce after looking at the pepper scoville chart. 

1. Service is slow. Don't go here if you only have an hour for lunch. 

2. Food is so so. Ordered the lamb briyani, meh. 

3. Small portions and pricey.

4. Ghost chili sauce lacks the kick. Probably severely watered down as I didn't die from it.
author: John N.

description:
Rip off
food quantity is laughable.
two levels of taxes
Service sucks
food quality is okay -not that great.
Very pricey -
go some where else for better food.
author: Jose D.

description:
HORRIBLE!!!! the service was offensive and so bad. The waiter told me to move my plate and give him some room. Wtf?! 
Prices are terrible for disgusting food, and overpriced!
author: Sue B.

description: What great Indian food:)) my friend and I had 3 dishes that where absolutely delicious. Could not finish them all but took them home for later. Their hospitality was outstanding! The owner came over and introduced himself. This is my new favorite Indian eats in San Francisco:)). Go there!!
author: Erika R.

description: My husband got chicken tandoori and I got plain naan and mixed vegetable curry. Plain naan was fresh and good, but everything else was below average. Chicken tandoori and mixed vegetable curry did not meet expectation. In a scale of 1 to 10, I would say it was 4. My mixed vegetable curry had 2 pieces of green beans, one huge piece of potato and some gravy. And it did not taste good. Additionally, service was poor. Servers need training indeed.
author: Ana T.

description: Great service and great food. Our waiter was really nice. The restaurant was clean and not too loud or crowded.
author: Cameron B.

description: Wow.....after seeing the reviews I decided to dine there tonight. Boy was I disappointed. The portions were small, the food was flavorless and the manager was very rude. I should have known from only seeing one table occupied but I gave them the benefit of the doubt. I'm guessing they cater mostly to American clientele whose pallets aren't as refined. IF YOU ARE INDIAN......STAY AWAY UNLESS YOU LIKE OVER PRICED BLAND FOOD.
author: Archer N.

description:
I thought this was pretty good for what it is.  It has a much larger inside that how it appears from the outside.  Walk through the bar area and it opens up to a cavernous atrium, complete with pillars.  Pretty cool.  We were comforted by seeing a few Indian families already eating there.

Service: on the slow side, which was OK because I was catching up with an out of towner.  It was a bit strange when we walked up -- with half the restaurant empty -- and they asked if we had a reservation.  Well, no... They then told us it'd be a five minute wait.  Maybe a kitchen staffing issue.

Food: decent to good.  A friend and I had samosas to start, and then the chicken masala curry and the chicken tikka masala (ok ok, I concede this was not the most adventurous order).

Prices: a little on the pricier side, but given the location and that this is SF, I guess it's pretty commonplace.  We took advantage of a yelp deal and got 50% off our second entree.

I likely won't come back because it's far from where I live and it didn't wow me, but it fit for the circumstances.  I certainly wouldn't discourage others from trying it out for themselves.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Delicious and tasty food with very pleasant service! Better than Gaylord. That's right, I said it. If you are looking for an elegant sitting area and great food, look no further. On top of that, Ranjan, the owner, is very friendly and we've had some wonderful conversations from travel stories, to origination of Indian food and well life's journeys. His bar makes very creative drinks. Some that will remind you of a summer day in India and others that will remind you of being on a beach with a refreshing drink in hand. The menu has not only the Indian food you normally hear about, but also very tasty creative dishes like Lemon Mustard Panner Tikka. 

Definitely a wonderful dining experience!
author: Avneesh N.

description: Tried to use the yelp coupon for 50% off our second entree. We ordered the chicken tikka masala and chicken biriyani but the waitress said she couldn't give us the discount because apparently the biriyani is not considered an entree even though it is not listed as a side on the menu (and was more expensive than the tikka masala)!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
So this place SUCKS, if you want to spend around 25 to 30 dollars per person and want meager quantities of food, then New Delhi is your place. 

Let me go in detail what was wrong with New Delhi
- Utensils not cleaned properly
- Good ambiance but the chair was squeaking
- Menu was good but the Main thing food was horrible
- Quantities were so small

If you like good indian food, i would recommend to go chutney or lahor karachi.
author: Jack W.

description: This is hands down, the single best Indian food restaurant in the Bay Area. Their food is solid but it's the wonderful service and exceptional staff that top of the most authentic Indian dishes you could possibly ask for. The environment is terrific as well, nice art makes for a great atmosphere and a great date place. I can eat the samosas all day long, and the butter chicken amazing but I always just let the staff choose my meals for me. They have a great selection of premium Indian beers as well.
author: Nathan S.

description: Amazing. I have been craving Indian food for awhile and this place totally hit the spot. The flavors, the spices, the ambiance and the staff especially my waitress Kiran, were amazing. She gave me her recommendations on what to eat and she food not disappointment me. If you are looking for a good Indian spot in the area you have to try this place.
author: Kimberly M.

description: The food is just not of the right quality. After complaining about the seekh Kabab which was as hard as a stone the server says "we are sorry but thank you". Horrible!!!!
author: Nikhil N.

description: Wedding banquet catering was exceptional. The food was delicious and we got ton of compliments from our guests. Would highly recommend both the restaurant in SF and the catering business.
author: Erin W.

description: No flavors, small quantities and highly over priced. Never had such bad Indian food anywhere!  Only go to waste your money!!!
author: Tanvi T.

description: The food is good very delicious and so spicy. The attitude of the manager is unbelievable by the time I set he came up Sir u better give order right now kitchen is getting closed I can't take ''in a rush and unrespectful manner" I said relax let me open the menu. Later on while I was eating he came up for apology. I said I can't stop myself writing a yelp review.  Try the food during the day time u will not be shouted.
author: Mustafa B.

description: If you ever make it to San Francisco it is a must that you come and visit New Delhi Indian Restuarant. This place is amazing, there food is just perfect, I loved everything we had, not too spicy, you actually get to enjoy the flavor. Not to mention you must try the Lechee Martini!!! Just perfect! I have loved this place for years, you truly get amazing service here. Hands down best place in town!
author: Dunia M.

description:
Better food to be had off Highway 101..=) 
(well at least the portions at Taste of India are bigger). New Delhi charges 12bucks for 2 tiny pieces of kofta in your tiny curry dish...ludicrous..& it's not even real kofta. It's this pre-made crap they just dump into the pre-made curry. Mediocre food dressed up to look like its exceptional, which it's not.......(they use the same curry sauce for every dish and then add whatever specific ingredients required, chicken, lamb, shrimp, paneer...you get my drift). It tasted microwaved. Plus they don't serve any condiments with the entrees not even some onions or chutney. Thats not cool. Even Air India gives you aachar. sup wid dat?!

The goan fish curry was pretty awful. 

Well I'm guessing they think since they're in Union Square they can get away with ripping off tourists. The portion size is unforgivable in comparison to what they are charging. Or maybe they overcharge to pay for the ridiculous overhead (Roman columns and Grecian fans blowing everywhere).
Highway Robbery.

wait....bill clinton ate here? cool. you get a star for that.
author: D R.

description: Brought my wife for dinner last night, Food was AMAZING!!! Not to spicy, just the right portions, and a good price. Definatly comming back
author: Sean C.

description: Ate there last nice and were very impressed with the food, service and ambience.  We've been in Texas for 20+years, from London, and didn't realize how I had missed a good Ruby Murray.  Special treat on my trip to SF. Try it.
author: Ruben R.

description:
Okay, first of all, how many restaurants do you know that have been in business as long as they have? That goes to show you how experienced and wonderful the restaurant is.

This restaurants serves some of the tastiest, fresh food I've EVER had. The Mango Mushroom Prawn was absolutely delicious and the Curry Chicken was to die for. I've seen other reviews complaining about the service but I've found it extremely efficient and the customer service is down-to-earth and inviting. I've also seen others saying it is expensive which is ridiculous when comparing against other Indian restaurants and the service is well worth the price. This is a family owned restaurant and it makes you feel welcomed from the time you walk thru the door till the time you walk out the door.

Thank you Ranjan Dey for making my experience so special!
author: Judy L.

description:
I was visiting SF and was staying in the neighborhood and wanted to get some Indian food for dinner. I ordered Malai Kofta and Garlic Naan for takeout. 

Pros:
- The food was ready on time (within 10 minutes)

Cons:
- The Malai Kofta was tasting horrible. There was way too much coconut in it, and the stuffing inside the kofta tasted bad. I literally felt it was stale food, and had no more than 2-3 spoons of the curry. 
- I was very clear when I placed the order for Garlic Naan. To my surprise, I found they packed Plain Naan but charged me for Garlic Naan.

I am never going back here again.
author: Vid S.

description:
I love Indian food.
It is too hard to find in L.A so when I came to San fran I was really excited to go for some.
Hit the jackpot.
Creamy Butter chicken,
Pakoras with incredible tamarind chutney and mint cilantro chutney ( my favorite)
The saag was terrific
We got some sizzling prawn dish that was particularly delish.
I think whatever floats your boat Indian style is here so pick, sit back and gorge!
Go hungry.
author: Lindsay A.

description: This is our go to Indian restaurant whenever we're in town. Great food, great service and reasonably priced.
author: Camilla M.

description: Great food but dont be fooled by the closing time ... Restaurant closes at 10pm only bar is open till 2am
author: Himangshu S.

description: Amazing restaurant! I've been here a couple times now, and it is probably some of the best Indian food I've had. The palak paneer is out of this world as was the murgh akbari. Both are a must try. Cannot wait to go back again!
author: Alex V.

description: Extremely EXPENSIVE!!!! Service was slow, food was stale and portion sizes were extremely small, it's like kids size.
author: Akshay A.

description:
It was the first day at my new job and I didn't feel like making dinner in the evening. Indian food is pretty maddening to suss out in the Financial District, if you're looking for something cheap and quick. Having remembered there was a restaurant right on Market Street, I puttered over there, only to find entrees for $30 and an ambiance that didn't seem to suit itself to the jeans and sweatshirt I was wearing.

Plus, it looked like the kind of place that didn't view take-out orders all that kindly.

I found New Delhi on my phone's search and made my way over there. I much would've preferred the tried and true Gaylord's at One Embarcadero (amazing mutter paneer, if anyone's interested), but I didn't feel like making the trek in the opposite direction of my home, so New Delhi it was.

New Delhi's pretty centrally located, not far off Market Street, and not so far west as to end up in the Tenderloin (thumbs up on that end since it was after dark and I had my laptop with me). It offers a menu outside its doors so you can decide what's what before entering. Menu items are priced a little high, in my opinion, with meat entrees in the $15-20 range. At that point though, I just wanted to go home and decided I'd give them a try and get on with my night.

Ambiance: Really lovely, actually. New Delhi is a bit narrow at the entrance, with a bar on the right and some basic seating on the left. Keep walking forward past the bar and you'll find a hostess and a much wider, more spacious dining area that I was actually tempted to stay and eat in. Alas, I wanted to go home more, so I asked about take out and was told they could accommodate.

Order speed: The hostess was polite, and my order of chicken tikka masala, rice, and garlic naan came out in under 10 minutes. Total cost with 15% tip was about $27. So much for avoiding that $30 price tag.

Food: I got a veritable tub of rice for the $4.95 price, probably way more than one human being really needs. The naan came sliced in two and cost $1.95, as I recall. Fair enough. The chicken tikka masala was $14.95. For that price (which to me is a good $2-3 more than it really should be for a relatively basic dish), I expected a tub of tikka to match the rice. It really didn't seem like I got a lot -- of chicken or the full-out dish -- for that price. Yet I expected to be able to eat it in one serving and didn't manage past 3/4 of it. I eat relatively little though, portion-wise, so a lot of people could probably finish it off pretty easily.

Taste: No complaint on the rice or the naan, but I do have an inquiry about the chicken tikka masala. Why is it that every place in this city I've tried has given me different flavors of what should be a pretty basic and static dish? To me, chicken tikka masala is tomato-based and orange. I've had a variety of colors of sauces when ordering this dish, the majority of which are more yellow in appearance. I can't really complain about the taste of the dish, since it was decent; it just didn't taste like chicken tikka masala, and that was unquestionably disappointing.

Verdict: 3/5 stars, maybe? The ambiance was gorgeous within the restaurant, and it's clear New Delhi uses fresh ingredients. I'm just a little frustrated by the portion sizes and the taste of what should be a pretty uniformly made dish. I'd like to go back and try out a vegetarian dish, but the price, coupled with what I assume is a pretty consistent serving size, is a little prohibitive and unencouraging.

If someone wants to buy me my next dinner there though...well, no complaints on my part.
author: Andrew S.

description: Here for a private event. The food was quite good, had several helpings of the eggplant & samosas. The staff was great. Was introduced to the owner. He was quite cordial. Finishing off the meal with rice pudding. Thank you John & Michael Nulty for inviting me. My wife loved the cocktail samosas.
author: Johnson H.

description: Definitely one of the worst Indian restaurants in the entire USA. Loaded with salt and cardamom, food was dry and cold. Save your money, any other place would be better than this.
author: Tony S.

description: We were looking for a place to eat and stumbled upon this place. The owner said it would be a 45 min wait however we had a table in 10 min. The food was delicious. The only problem is the portion sizes. Otherwise the food was great!
author: Keya M.

description:
My friend and I stumbled on this restaurant after finding out there was an hour wait for another restaurant.  This place is just a couple of blocks from Union Square.  The outside is just a little door and you would think that it is just an average place inside.

That assumption would be wrong.

You walk in and there is a posh bar on the left.  You walk straight ahead and you find yourself in a cavernous restaurant.  There are beautiful art work on the walls, lots of small comfy tables.  The service is impeccable and very friendly.  Our waitress was definitely great.  She was the kind of person you would want to hang out with.  You never have to ask for more water or anything because someone always magically appears and refills your glass.

I had originally ordered the paneer, which though good could not compare to my friend's chicken korma.  Naturally we had to order a second entree of the korma and eat ourselves into cardiac arrest.  Seriously the best korma i have ever had.

The owner/chef also came out and asked us how we were enjoying our food, which was a wonderful touch.

I will definitely be heading back here on my next visit to San Fran.
author: Alexis M.

description: This restaurant is at good location. The ambiance is good but the food is not authentic Indian style. It was more american version of Indian curries. The staff  was very slow.
author: Shivani S.

description:
I expected an Indian restaurant in downtown San Francisco to be way WAY better than this! It is grossly overpriced. And the food is terrible. Simply terrible!
It was bland, watered down and the samosa was 'rotten'. It really was. It was stinking really bad. I didn't want to start an argument there, so I didn't say anything, but honestly, it was spoiled :(. 
The Dal that came with the vegetarian thaali was little more than just boiled.
We eat at Naan n Curry a lot and for less than half the price, it gives you way better and fresher food - all you can eat. If you have any choice at all, avoid this restaurant. If you have a choice between McDonalds and this restaurant, choose McDonald's. Seriously, that's how bad this is!
author: Debashri S.

description:
The service and the food was really good. This was my first time coming to this restaurant with my son and we had a great time. Learning about other culture of food is a good thing or else it will be too boring in life.

I will definitely recommend other people to try this restaurant. I will go back there will my friends for sure.

Thank you for your great service.
author: Wai W.

description:
I went twice to the restaurant with a friend to try it out. The servers were horrible. They made us take the seat and later asked us that we need to get our food as take out since the kitchen will close in 25 minutes.  The two girls of indian origin did not show any interest on the customers and they looked so pissed off.   
The first time I went, the indian guy who hardly could speak english tells me that the kitchen will close in 45 minutes. Damn,,,these indians have left their souls back home and only their unattractive body is here in san francisco.

A small advice to the owner. They need to hire more professional and customer oriented people who make your ambiance of the restaurant greater with the decor.
author: Jason L.

description: Worst service! I had ordered a delivery and the food never showed up. I tried calling the restaurant several times and no one cared to answer. What makes it worse is that I ordered food at a non peak order and yet got terrible service. Should have read the reviews on yelp before giving this place a try.
author: Neha M.

description:
I called this place accidentally when I was trying to call Little Delhi to order Prawn Birani, chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. 
When I arrived the place was nice but service was super slow. I mean, dude, I'm just there to pick up food that was ready to go. The bartender took his sweet time getting me the check. When the check arrived It was over $55! Seriously! $55 for prawn birani and chicken tikka masala?! I was super upset but took the meal home anyway. The meal itself was not as tasty as what I would have gotten at Little Delhi and for half the price. 

Slow, unfriendly bartender, expensive price, and mediocre food. I wouldn't come here again!
author: Yia V.

description:
I don't know what Indian food is like in SF, but for the price of each dish, you're better off finding another place. But if you can't resist your cravings, here are some decent dishes:

Spicy Madras Tamarind Chicken
This stuff is actually spicy and the chicken goes well with the tangy flavor and spiciness.

Bombay Saffron Bhuna Lamb
It might have been my first time trying saffron, and I liked it a lot. The meats here are very cooked to near perfection, and the dish was quite delicious.

There was also another dish with spinach and chicken and that was really delicious as well. The spinach was really soft and complemented the tender chicken.

The mango lassi was good, but was very small and very sweet (perhaps too sweet).

Each samosa was about the size of your fist and quite filling.

The waiters here are great. They notice instantly when your cup is empty and fill it with water immediately. 

Overall it was not a bad experience as it was very quiet and the food was not bad, but the price of the food around this area is pushing me away.
author: Jason T.

description: Impeccable service with the most delightful plates of Perfectly spiced lamb and chicken .  Highly recommend the condiment tray and special lemonaide!  Atmosphere !
author: Jackie M.

description:
The only thing that could have made our experience worse is if we all came down food poisoning or were attacked by bedbugs. I say this only because service sucked with a giant enormous unsaid "fuck you" from the waiter. 

I came here for a good-bye lunch with my colleagues. For a restaurant that was so empty at peak lunch hours, they were bizarrely unwelcoming to our large group of asian (read: fatty) diners. Yes, we had a large group. Yes, we just walked in (b/c our first choice restaurant was closed that day), but by the way... your restaurant was completely devoid of living, breathing, eating, or paying customers. 

Our waiter did not want to be bothered to take drink orders or even our orders for food. When he finely deigned to stroll over, he aggressively pushed us to increase the amount of dishes we were ordering even though it would be obvious even to starving children that they would die from hypophosphatemia if they ate that much. He blew off members of our party - actually looked at our raised hands, heard our "excuse me?", turned his back on us and walked away. We had to wave our arms up and down as if guiding fighter jets to landing or poke the damn man in the shoulder to get his attention.

NO BUENO. 

Food actually tasted decent. Portions were hideously tiny and overpriced. Garlic Naan was made with garlic powder not actual garlic. Bleh. 

With so many better options for Indian food in SF, why would you subject yourself to this kind of treatment? 

I'd rather eat at the Berkeley McDonalds where you're served from  those bulletproof clear walls, at least they say "Have a nice day" there!
author: Andrea L.

description: ZERO STARS. This is THE WORST place you can go to. I am Indian and I know what Indian food tastes like and it does't taste like this crap. You can have all the nice ambience you want but if the food is not good no one gives a damn. No wonder over 80% of the tables in this place are always empty. I don't mind small portions but I expect the food to be good. Every item I ordered was very sweet. Are they using Sugar instead of Salt? If you can't change your Chef, do close down. I love my country and the food, and I would hate to see it misrepresented (especially he named the place after the Country's capital). Folks - this is not what Indian food tastes like, please be aware.
author: Brad C.

description: Actually went to the wrong restaurant, meant to go to Little Delhi which had 4 stars.  I ordered the Fish Goa Curry with a side of Garlic naan.  I liked the taste of the salmon dish, but it was just average and a dinky portion (I'm a big eater).  The salmon seemed to crispy, but the sauce was outstanding.  The naan was nothing to write home about, but it was cheap and came in handy when I needed to mop up the curry to fulfill my appetite.  The food came very quickly, like 5 min.  Probably scooped it out of a hot table.  Not bad, but not great, which I was really hoping for, so I was left somewhat disappointed.  Not sure I'd come back since there are other choices around the corner.  Oh and the pistachio ice cream was weird and gross
author: P H.

description: I was in the city most of this week for a conference and happened upon the New Delhi this afternoon while on my way back to BART.  And I am glad I did!  My lunch turned out to be one of those Kismet experiences, and a good one at that.  I dug the interior of the restaurant; it evoked a mood that fit the cuisine.  Since it was just me, I limited myself to one appetizer and one entree.  The Samosas were perfect - the best I've had.  The Chicken Biriyani was top shelf.  I consider the prices reasonable and a good value given the quality of the food.  As I told my server, my barometer of food is to eat it plain and unadorned to gauge its quality and flavor.  Neither of these dishes needed a thing and the seasonings were deep and rich with just the right "bite" I look for in Indian cuisine.  But each dish was enhanced, ever so slightly, by the accompanying sauces.  The service was fantastic; my server was very sweet and attentive.  She seemed genuinely interested when she inquired about the meal and she listened to my take and perspective on the dishes.  I really liked her style - unobtrusive, helpful and sincere.  Wish I knew her name so she could get her props.  I liked the fact that it was relatively quiet at lunch time, but I would like to return in the evening for dinner.  I'm reserving a fifth star for a time when we can explore the menu further.  There is certainly that potential.  I ordered a couple of to-go dishes for my wife, who is home sick today.  I'm curious about her opinion.  I will try to taste a bit of each to broaden my perspective of the restaurant's offerings.  I will definitely go back and encourage others to check it out.  What an unexpected treat!
author: Chris B.

description: Ate here for the first time this evening and was extremely happy with the experience! The atmosphere was relaxed - soft music and lights, people on dates, small groups of friends, a couple of families with young children. We tried some of the vegetarian offerings and we're very pleased. Next time I'll be eager to try the tikka masala thali dinner. Great food, wonderful setting, and a very friendly and intuitive team of folks running the place - highly recommended!
author: Katie F.

description:
We went there because we had a guest in town and she wanted to eat something veggie.  So ended up going to this restaurant.  

We ordered  matar paneer, navrattan curry and paneer tikka masala.  They all tasted same and sweet.  Apparently they put the same curry in all the dishes, so they taste the same.  We ordered lassi and we couldn't finish it because it tasted so bad.  The restaurant isn't cheap either as it cost us $60 for the three veg items, lassi, bread and rice.  

Don't tip the waiters also as it goes into owner's pocket and not into server's pocket.  

I am a south Asian, have lived in India and have eaten in a lot of Indian restaurants in US.  By far they have the worst Indian food.  I can't understand how it is getting the 4 or 5 star ratings from other people.
author: Sunil P.

description:
One instance when I regret not reading reviews posted by my fellow Yelpers. 

Food: Completely bland, over priced and by no way authentic Indian. 
Good ambience, service and cocktails though..
author: Ruchika I.

description:
It's your standard Indian restaurant with your typical Punjabi fare. It's probably one of the better Indian restaurants in the Union Square area- not the best Indian I've had, but good nonetheless. 

I would highly recommend the "Shah Jahani Madeera" drink off the wine menu. It's like an Indian-style sangria (minus the fruit pieces in the drink). It pairs perfectly with Indian food. I would come back for this alone!
author: Amit P.

description: San Francisco, your Indian food has really disappointed me. This is the second Indian restaurant I tried in the downtown area and was disappointed a 2nd time. Ordered the Vegetarian dinner/thali. The curries had no flavors. Were not even properly seasoned. The decor was nice, the rice and naan were nice. But the curries were just a major disappointment. Cannot recommend this place. Another thing, I noticed the amount they charged me was much higher than the amount they showed me on the check. Like 6 bucks higher on a 22 dollar bill. If those were taxes ( can't imagine such high taxes ), should've been mentioned on the check. But I didn't have energy to fight, paid it + tip and left. Never going back again.
author: SonU V.

description: Basically this Indian restaurant is the best in SF.. I've tried many Indian restaurant here and this one has the taste, price and service  definitely it worth 5 stars.. I highly recommend Shrimp Masala, Chicken Masala and Tandoori.
author: A S.

description: Came here on a weeknight hopping to get some great Indian food. We didnt want to leave Union Square so we decided to check this place out, but after dining at this place I wish we went somewhere else. The first thing you walk in to this establishment that it was old but clean. There is a full bar as you walk in and if you continue to walk down the path is where the restaurant it located. The menu was extensive, I thought it was a little pricey, but maybe the portions were big enough to justify. My water glass was not clean and had lip markings on from the previous person. After i noticed dirt on my glass my friend also examined his water glass and he had some brown crusty thing on the bottom of his glass. The service was good, they were very attentive and always filling up our waters. when the food came out it was small. The portions they offered could have feed just one person and we ordered 6 dishes and were not full at all. Overall I would never return to this location just based on finding dirt in my water glass.
author: Matthew L.

description: Good place for drinks. I have never eaten here. But their  bar tenders are very nice and it's pretty classy
author: Jake C.

description:
As I have always said this is my favorite restaurant. I have been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. 

I do also really enjoy the staff and how they remember me and my name. It makes me feel great and that they appreciate my business. 

I took my younger brother (21 years old) and made him try the hot sauce, you know the hottest sauce in the world. It was hilarious. I should of have filmed it for the internet.

The location is great, after you eat you can walk just a few blocks to Union Square and enjoy the evening. 

Thanks Ranjohn and your staff. Cheers!
author: Steve S.

description: I don't understand the negative reviews. I've been here a dozen or more times over the years and the food is the best I've had.  The service is fantastic, the restaurant is always clean and inviting and did I mention the food is awesome?   Just a great place to enjoy a wonderful meal with your friends or family.
author: Michael R.

description: The samosas and the bartenders are phenomenal here! They really treat you like you are at 'cheers'. If you are looking for good Indian food with a good drink selection check out New Delhi!
author: Jay Y.

description: Several colleagues and I stopped off at New Delhi for a quick lunch during our break. The food was served quickly and was flavorful and savory, and the service was friendly and attentive. I took a star off for timeliness because the dining room had less than 10 patrons and it took a good 5-10 minutes to bring us our drinks. Otherwise the experience was quite delightful! I would definitely go here again.
author: Tricia W.

description:
Went here twice, but only ate here once.

The first time going, service was slow...extremely slow.  We got a table and just sat.  And waited.

Finally, we ordered food.

We waited.

It took an inordinately long time for the food to be brought to the table.  The food was decent--certainly not worth a 40 minute wait.  

Then there was the wait for the bill.  We asked for it.  We waited.  We waited some more.  Finally, on this not-packed-evening, they decided to bring it our way.  We then waited for them to pick it up.  And waited.

Yes, there is a subtle pattern here.


Second visit was tonight (1/1/11).  It was one of the few places open and busier than the last time.  There were no tables immediately open for 2 people, so we walked to the counter to sit.  Spread out in front of 6 or so empty counter seats were piles of napkins, plates, cutlery.

First off--and I should have mentioned this sooner--when we walked in, we stood awkwardly, waiting for someone to greet us and show us a table or ask us to wait.  Nothing.  I did make eye contact with two different employees who looked away and ignored us.  That was when we walked over to the counter seats.

So, we're at the counter seats:

I ask a girl walking by, "Is it ok if we sit here?"  She says, "No, that's a work station," and walks away.

We just decided to walk out.

This place has shitty service.  I remember the food being above mediocre, but nothing justifies ignoring customers and being rude.  There are too many other places to eat at in this city.

I will not return there.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This review probably deserves 3-1/2 stars.  I went there with three friends for supper on Wednesday, 11 December.  About two hours before arriving (at 7 PM), I had made a reservation on Open Table after trying to call the place to make the reservation -- no one answered the phone -- and was a bit concerned when a couple of other friends bailed on us at the last second because it was emphasized that only complete parties will be seated within ten minutes of the reservation time.  However, my concerns there were for naught.  

Once we were seated, it took a pretty long time for the waitress to come to ask us what we wanted to drink; in fact, by the time she did, we had already decided what we wanted to eat.  Indeed, the mediocre quality of the service stood out as a weak point of the establishment.  

I ordered the non-vegetarian complete dinner.  Quality of the food was very good to excellent, even if slightly westernized in style, but the portion size was a bit smaller than I expected for the price and the name of the entree.  

The atmosphere was consistent with a fancier-than-average restaurant, but there appeared to be no dress code.
author: Danny B.

description:
I signed up to yelp due to this restaurant.  

The atmosphere, service, and food where phenomenal. Samosa appetizer was pretty standard, but the entrees and drinks were awesome.
author: Kai H.

description:
I love coming to New Delhi. I've been here at least 6 times, and every time I as entirely pleased. Be it with 2 people or 6 people, I've always been happy I came.

Every single dish I've had has been wonderful, be it their specials, their curries, or their tandooris. No matter the meat, it was wonderfully well prepared. I personally tend toward chicken and shrimp dishes, and every single one I've had hasn't disappointed.I'd especially recommend the dishes from their in-house specials list. You really can't go wrong there. The naan is always delicious and fresh, the rice always perfect. 

The service is regularly attentive. I've never felt like I was being neglected or ignored. My water has always been full. I've always been informed about dishes, wait times, etc. The staff is knowledgeable about the food as well, and is ale to easily offer up suggestions.

So, why 4 stars? Well, the prices are high here, and that may irk some people.

Even so, it's one of my favorite Indian restaurants.
author: Adam G.

description:
$15 for inauthentic Chicken Tikka Masala? Additional $2 for Garlic Naan that doesn't taste like garlic?  The only redeeming factor was probably their mango lassi, but not for $5.

Wait, you let us into your restaurant but you don't open until 5:30PM?  So, we get to sit and wait with water until 5:30PM?  

Oh?  You'll let us order first?  But, wait, you won't put in the order until 5:30PM.  So, the food won't start cooking until 5:30PM?  Then we just get to continue to sit here with our water? Lovely. 

I have never experienced service like this before.  This experience probably goes in the books for one of my worse experience with customer service.  I suppose if they told us that they weren't open yet when we enter, then I wouldn't have too much to complain about.  It is extra sensitive because we were actually in a rush.  Had we known that they didn't open until 5:30, believe me that we would have gone elsewhere.  Since we were already there and it would have probably taken more time to go find another place - we stayed.  

Was it worth it? No.  Was the food amazing? No.  Was the service horrible? Yes.  Will I return? Nope.  Overall, 2 stars at best!  The extra star is for their mango lassi that came promptly after I ordered it. A very disappointing experience, very unfortunate. Sigh.
author: Cindy P.

description: After 15 minutes of three different servers ignoring me I walked out.  Apparently the 2/3 empty restaurant didn't need my trade.
author: Jeff J.

description:
Cuisine of the Maharaja's-- My Foot!!!!

I am not sure how this place has survived for so long, and as the Chef/ Owner claims, to have served the food of the Maharajs to the modern day Presidents. It is by far the worst Indian food I have ever eaten in 25 years of my travels across USA from foodie places like New York & LA, to relatively smaller places with a small Indian population: the Little Rocks and Nashvilles... All in all, this could easily be the worst Indian restaurant in all of USA for what it boasts and what it delivers..it is a shame that such a place claims to represent the great Indian cuisine in a food Mecca like San Francisco.

 Where should we start?

All those Chefy descriptions of the dishes, they are just those. The dish and descriptions have utterly no correlation. Hariyali Murg Tikka, as the waitress haughtily informed us at the beginning, took more than 30 min. Even after that it was hardly cooked and had to be sent back to cook fully as I was worried the kids may get sick. Lamb Bhuna is a disgrace, and the Chicken Madrasi was...let us not go there...
The restaurant boasts a picture of Hyderabad Nizam on its walls along with other erstwhile Indian Royalty. As someone from Hyderabad, I can assure you that the Nizam would not even feed his dogs with what they are selling as Biryani here. The chef should visit the restaurant at the Nizam's palace in Hyderabad to get an appreciation of what Biryani looks and tastes like. This restaurant is a disgrace to all the great Royal cuisines of India and should be condemned for its fraudulent representation of Indian cuisine to our American friends and other unsuspecting visitors like us. They may claim to have the recipes, but the execution is utterly lacking. I felt completely cheated by the clever marketing of this place and one should do everything to stop such frauds..

The Chef/owner keeps insisting in some of his Yelp replies, that these are the tastes and flavor of the Royal houses and not the Indian street food. At the end of the day, good taste and flavors are  what they are, whether they are found in the Royal houses or at the street corner. And as many reviews on Yelp say, this place seems to have neither authentic royal flavors nor the street corner flavors. If you are visiting San Francisco, please avoid this place. Please read other reviews on Yelp. They are all very true. I did a mistake of not reading them beforehand. This place is a disgrace to the great Indian cuisine whether Royal or otherwise !!
author: Yugender C.

description: Staying at Parc 55 there are several great Indian options I was able to try and this on was one of my favorites for their lamb speciality dish (can't remember the name) and spiced vegetable side. Nan was just ok. The ambiance was the nicest of the three places I tried this trip.
author: Deno R.

description: I attended an incredible event at New Delhi today and was completely impressed. Food was fresh, beyond flavorful and made with love. The staff were warm, professional and attentive. The leader of this compassionate establishment is the real deal--committed to his craft, dedicated to sharing his passion, and brimming with intention on educating and improving his community. Oh, and the setting is dripping with history, cleanliness, and attention to detail. Perfect for date night or group gathering. Guaranteed to impress!
author: Andrea T.

description:
An under appreciated Indian restaurant. Food was excellent and service was better than last time I was there. They were slow on bar service last time, but now they are on it. Great cocktails though I don't like the high ball glass.  More of a cocktail appropriate stemware would be better. 

Started with the Tandoori Platter; chicken tikka, seekh keebab and tandoori prawn;  Great and then on to the Murg Akbari, Lamb Vindaloo, and Navrattan Curry.  All were great. 

And the super hot waitress is still there as well! ;-)
author: J H.

description:
