No complanits about service.
author: Jay S.

description: the place is OK.... nothing to be excited about.  very pricey for indian food.  I didnt tasted anything that was especially better than any other indian places ive been to.
author: Janet S.

description: It's very Americanized Indian food which is good for people who can't handle hot/spicy stuff. Not bad for getting introduced to Indian food though. I've tried it once and it's not for me. Focus is more on ambiance & food is just ok.
author: A K.

description:
The prices here are ridiculous. I am willing to pay astronomical prices for good food and service, but not for okay food and bizzare service. New Delhi fits into the second category.
When we walked over to the restaurant, a server was outside getting some fresh air. When he saw us approaching, he went into the restaurant and let the door slam in my face. I walked in and went past the bar to the host's computer. That same weirdo just stared at me for almost 90 seconds before finally someone right next to him noticed his behavior and askled if I would like a table.
We were seated in the empty half of the restaurant (there was a banquet group that had not arrived yet). A minute later, they sat another couple right next to us. Hmmm, there is a whole section of restaurant available for parties of two. Why must they be seated next to us, and why leave the rest of the section bare?
The weirdo guy kept looking over at us, but never came over to take our order. Finally, another server saw us and came over.
The food here is fine, but not worth the silly prices they charge for it. Honestly, I've tasted much better for less. The mango lassie was all right. The samosas were done well. The curries come in 4 heat levels: mild, medium, wild and dangerous. I found the medium to be way to mild and the dangerous to be just a bit too hot. Other than that, the kofta was good and the rogan josh was not that great. They charge for papadums and condiment trays. They should have been free. Their curries do not come with anything. You have to pay for rice or naan separately.
The weirdo server kept coming to our table every 30 seconds to check on us. It was severely annoying. The other server, however, was great.
Like the yelp category states, "Meh. I've experienced better."
author: sibani b.

description: the restaurant was a very welcoming atmosphere. An indian restaurant with a little bit of class. the servers were really nice and the mango mojito is the best!!
author: Terria H.

description: first time coming here.. it was really cozy inside and temp is hot.. I cam here with couple of friends and the owner was really nice and the bartender was so friendly that he took a shot with us.. a lot of seating.. The lemon drop was delicious and it is a girls drink. I would definitely come back for drinks and try their food..  great place to take on a date and hang out with FRiends..
author: Lily T.

description: We ate dinner in March of this year. Peering into the window I could see the neatly folded fan shaped white linen napkins atop the tables. I knew this would be my kinda place. The waiters were soft spoken and prompt and we enjoyed our conversation without interruption. Nice atmosphere.
author: Hieu D.

description: We went to New Delhi restaurant for the first time on 5th July which was a Friday. Honestly had great expectations for the place and the food but i would describe my experience to be absolutely Disappointing . Starting from Food to Service , everything was just bad and i will never like to go again to this place ever . We took some guests to New Delhi Restaurant  who were visiting us from LA and we really were embarrassed with the food and the place . we got the table easily and it was not too crowded as well.. We ordered assorted Vegetarian Platter.. Its suppose to be a platter but we were actually surprised since it only consists of 2 oily onion rings , 3-4 veggie pakodas , 1 samosa and 1 papad.. Everything looked and smell stale and there was a bad oily smell .. When we placed our order for main course , it took the staff almost 40 minutes to serve the food on the table . we ordered Kaali daal and Malai kofta for main course with garlic naan .. Kaali daal was  tasteless with no salt or any flavor..It tasted exactly like a boiled daal . Malai Kofta again didn't had any taste and was bland. the quantity was less and we wanted to order more curries and rice but we were already so disgusted with the food and the service that we decided not to order anything else .. finally the last part .. When the bill arrived , my husband forgot to check the bill and gave his credit card for payment and they actually charged us double the amount of bill ..It was after sometime when the server realized that our card has been swiped for the wrong amount and they apologized for the mistake and voided the payment (They didn't even bother to call our credit card company to remove the transaction ) ..When i gave the feedback to the server about the quality and the service , the reply i got was that its crowded and the kitchen is busy . What a shame !
author: Nutan P.

description: Very good Indian food... the dal was a bit bland. Great chicken masala and mattar paneer. Service was excellent... I noticed our waiter was also doing the seating, but we were never ignored and they seemed to all share responsibility... restaurant was full. I would definitely go back.
author: RJ A.

description: I went here with a good friend mainly because I found a "Buy one entree get the second 50% off" coupon. I was a little skeptical at first, but in the end I was glad we went. The food was very good. I had the Rogan Josh and my friend had the Chicken Tikka. We started with some Semosas first. Very tasty and they had just the right amount of kick. The dinners were reasonably priced ($12 - 18) and it's enough to share with other people. They garlic Naan wasn't as garlicy as I'd wanted it to be, but it was soft and warm. The service was excellent and refilled our water every 5 mins. I'd definately go back the next time I'm in S.F.
author: David W.

description: I have eaten here both times I visited San Francisco. I love Indian food, and this is my favorite Indian restaurant of all time. The decor in the restaurant is very nice and it is located in the center of San Francisco, just a couple blocks from union square. My 18-month-old daughter LOVES this place too. I brought takeout back to the hotel room and she ate more than she had on the whole trip. Writing about it now makes me wish I could go back. If you live in San Francisco, don't miss out on your good fortune. Check out this restaurant today!
author: Kristine M.

description:
I read the reviews on yelp and saw the web site and thought let me try this place.
As described in one of the previous reviews you ever through the bar.  The decor inside the dinning area was extremely dull.  The walls lack luster a disgrace to New Delhi's colorful heritage and the royal kings pictures they have on their walls.  They had the temperature set to match New Delhi's in April because it was close to 77F.  After eating some spicy food just not the temperature to have.

Lets talk about the service!  As soon as we sat, we were served water and a couple menu cards - no one asked if we would prefer anything different.  After a really long wait & a few minutes of tapping our fingers on the table waiting for some one to take our order we got some service.  A vegetable appetizer sampler we ordered.  They would not substitute one of the items in there for another.   The waiters were most inattentive and same can be said about the person who took our order.

The food, murg akbari was mediocre.  The best part of my dinning experience was the onion kulcha.  

I would not recommend any of my friends to eat there.  I have eaten at better Indian restaurants where the food and service was superb.
author: Amit R.

description: nothing much to say!! this place is the BEST!! food is just YUMMY!!! the BAR has great selection!! the staff is just too friendly!
author: Corwin C.

description:
While lusting after this restaurant for months, we finally decided to venture within and taste was is claimed as the best Indian food in the city.  Their menu is colorful and unique, offering spiced dishes that cant be found anywhere else, and leaves you wishing you had a party of 10 so you could explore a taste of everything. The Chili Cheese Pakoras were phenomenal (the spiciest of everything we tried), and are the single hook that will reel me back for another dining event. Since there are items on the menu that can only be found here, we decided to test the waters and steer away from our typical Indian entrees. We had the Mustard Gobi (a tangy collieflower dish with amazingly complex flavor), the Soya Josh (a vegetarian take on the Rogan Josh recipe, which had a lackluster flavor, and used the cheapest of dehydrated soy products from china town), and the garlic nan. The naan was okay, dry and used garlic powder and no corriander leaves, and the rice (which didnt come with the meal) was great. 
The waitstaff was attentive, the ambiance is romantic and elegant, however hipsters beware as the patrons oogle you for leaving the collared shirts and slacks at home.
author: josh t.

description: Fast, friendly service.  Excellent naan, rice, and chicken dishes.  Beautiful fancy decor.  A bit  pricey.
author: Tuesday J.

description: I wanted to go back to mela for my birthday, but we called to make reservations, and they were closed. i guess they are moving. so after much hemming and hawing i decided to stay with indian and try new delhi. i still had a nice birthday because of the company and stuff but i wish i'd picked someplace else. there is a photo here on yelp with pink and all fancy looking restaurant, that's not how it looks. it looks like a plain boring hotel type place. we arrived early for our 8pm reservation on a saturday and were seated right away. we ordered a vegetarian platter appetizer, which was small, tiny and a waste of $.  one samosa (which was good) 2 onion rings and 4 bite sized somethings. the mango lassis were good, although small. b and i each had rogan josh that was pretty good nothing special.  j had one of the specials lamb dishes which barely had any meat in it. it first came out with nuts on it which no one noticed on the menu, but they replaced it for him. he liked it but it just wasnt enough food. s had tandoori lamb and they gave him a lot. the naan was good, and plentiful. our rice was very good. it's just the entrees that were meh. the worst thing was the water. they acted like we were in the middle of the sahara desert.  the waiter would only come around with water once in the longest while. the first time, he filled everyone's except mine. mine wasn't empty, but judging how infrequently he came, i knew i wanted it topped off. we ran after him and got him back to do mine too and he made some snide remark about is THIS filled enough for you?? the rest of the time, he'd keep only filling some of the peoples waters.  we were CONSTANTLY thirsty throughout the meal because he would never come refill us. Also, he had horrible BO. i am not one for perfumes and things, and generally dont notice or mind BO but when i notice it, it's bad.  still i wouldnt have cared, if we'd gotten water in a timely manner or if he didnt have such an obviously bitchy attitude, he even walked bitchy. oh well. the other people who worked there were nice enough. our bill came out to about $135 for four people which was pricey given the lack of atmosphere, mediocre service and just ok entrees. as i mentioned, great naan and rice, and good lassis. i still wont be back.
author: Merredith L.

description:
Absolute garbage.

There was another post here that mentioned how this place treats anyone who is not white like they are second class citizens, absolute truth. Me, being Indian, went there one night with my parents and gf (who is another type of minority). It as 615 PM, way before city dinner time, and the place was ABSOLUTELY empty. The hostess just took a look at us, and without me saying a single word, said sorry there are no open tables. Then I said how do you know I don't have a reservation (I didn't but that's besides the point)? So then she is like well do you? I said no. She said, well in about 30 minutes we will have every table full. I said that's fine, every table is empty except for two (with white tourists), we have a show in an hour so we won't be longer than 30 minutes. She said no sorry, our tables are reserved there is nothing I can do. WTF?!?!??! The place was empty and it was only 615!! And just the look on her face and her dumb ass manager who promptly came to her side just had this stare like they were absolutely disgusted to see actual Indians trying to eat here. Maybe they were actually being kind and not allowing us to eat because we would then tell everyone how crappy their food is...I don't know. 

Seriously, I don't know how good the food is but it's probably not authentic. Save yourself the trouble and go to Little Delhi down the street. They are super friendly, the food is a LOT cheaper, and it's not only authentic but really good without being overly greasy. 

The hell w/ New Delhi, this place will never see business from me or my family again. Nothing against white people but this place is a bunch of f'n sell-outs.
author: pankaj l.

description: The two best things to order off this menu are exactly that...off the menu.  Though a pretty standard item at Indian restaurants, the chicken tikka masala is left off the menu with the intention of making it a "special item" no one knows about.  That way when you ask your server what he recommends he gives you a schpeal about the chef's new and totally unheard of special creation called TEE-KA-MA-SA-LA that he only makes on special occasions, ie, everyday.  Earthy and full of the flavors of India, unnecessary hype aside, this is a very pleasant dish.  Not to be forgotten was another dish actually listed on the menu, the pullao raja.  Saffron flavored rice with almonds and raisins. I'm not normally a raisin eater but the textures of this dish cannot be denied, even by my picky palate.  The lychee martini (also not on the menu) is a nice accompaniment to your meal in this spacious restaurant reminiscent of the dining hall of a great maharaja.
author: Shelley H.

description: this place is fantastic! the ambiance is great, a decent wine list and the food is really tasty. i especially liked their baigan masala. worth the trek. yum!
author: rachel m.

description: a friend of mine had the kickoff dinner to her bachelorette party here back in august.  despite the shady location, new delhi takes a refreshing departure from the bay area's typical "hole-in-the-wall" south asian joints and is actually a "nice" restaurant in terms of ambience.  (palatial decor reminscent of the "raj," clean table linens, etc).  the food is quite good though perhaps not as tasty as some of the aforemetioned holes-in-the-wall, but the friendly waitstaff (who were willing to submit to our bachelorette party antics :) ) and ambience make for a generally pleasant experience!  i will probably be back sometime, if not soon.
author: Roshni R.

description: Food at this restaurant is good and authentic. So why three stars? We're a party of six that included two kids for whom we did not order anything, and we're charged a mandatory 20% gratuity! I also don't like the practice of charging gratuity on top of sales tax. What would be the incentive for the servers to go extra mile when they see a guaranteed tip? Since there are better options south of SF, I will not be returning to this place.
author: VIKRAM S.

description: We were looking for good Indian food and just randomly found this place. IT WAS GREAT. Everything about it was great. The food was really yummy (and they had some uncommon dishes like Paneer tiki masala!!!!!!!!! YUM.!) Very friendly and helpful. A great bar (lycee martini's were great). Nice waiter and when i asked about PORT the waiter brought the bartender straight to my table so we can ask directly. EVERYTHING about this place was great.  I love Indian food and hence am pretty picky, so for me to LOVE an Indian restaurant says a lot. Wish I was there right now (PS happy hour is 4-6 and 10-12 pm)
author: erika b.

description: unbelievably awful depressing meal.  must be better places to get indian in this city .. must be!
author: kylie o.

description: it all started good, then, after our group of 5 was sold on off the menu tiki masala and mango martinis, witch where very good, our waiter disappeared, literally, we where brought or food  and drinks by the water girl and never looked at again, not even for the bill. we could have just walked out. id rather go to a just as good place in the tenderloin.
author: Chizzy T.

description: Yellow dal tarka, baigan masala, onion kulcha. Winner combo. Best dal I've ever had. This place is a little expensive but it is worth it. I've also tried the stuffed spinach and spiced vegetables and they were not that great although the sag paneer is also excellent. Service is inconsistent, sometimes it takes a long time and sometimes it doesn't.
author: Sarah J.

description: I try to avoid the Tenderloin in the evening, but eating at New Delhi is worth it. The food is not greasy, spicy delicious, cheap, and the portions are perfect. Also, the chai is so yummy.
author: janice p.

description: they do wonderful indian food. we loved their restaurant so much we outsourced our food to them for our wedding. their catering is phenomenal - the food was all cooked hours before the wedding, and MANY of my guests said it was the best wedding food they ever had (not just the best indian wedding food!). the owner is really serious about growing his business and putting out a quality product - this business is his life, his passion, evident by the personal attention he gave to our catering order. can't wait to go to the restaurant to eat again!
author: Monica K.

description: my coworker/hoe bag (Michelle n.)  took me to this place. we needed drinks BAD, trying to avoid the unnecessary drama we were about to endure at the management meeting. booze will help ease the pain. booze makes it all good. greeted like we were old friends right when we walked in. except my coworker was the old friend. beautiful decor inside, makes you feel like you're really in India. I'm talking not just  about hanging a few paintings of India on the walls, decor comes down to even the architecture of the huge columns inside the restaurant. beautiful high ceilings, beautiful all over to look at. even the lighting was a perfect ambiance. bathrooms are nice, big, and clean. my hoe bag took a while in there. ("wtf, did you fall in?" "no, omg i spilled my makeup bag all over the floor and i was scrambling to pick it up" "hahahah"). i ordered a lychee martini and my coworker got a dirty one. (yea, she likes it REAL dirty.) my lychee martini was exactly the way i liked it. ice cold and sweet enough for only a slight alcoholic taste, and it was not at all weak. i even had 2! the hoe bag and i  enjoyed our drinks very much. left with a light buzz, definitely worth coming back to!
author: carmen n.

description: I went here last night with my gf.. and thought this was one of the worst Indian Restaurants i've been to. From the service to the bland food to just the overall high prices i DO NOT recommend this place. When we first walked we were asked if we had reservations.. and when we said no.. we were given a weird look. Upon arrive to our table a waiter gave us menu;s and we asked if we could get a cup of chai.. and he said u can tell you waiter instead of going down himself and ordering it himself. Once we were done eating we asked for boxes and we were told in a rude way we dont box food.. i said thats fine just give me a box and i will do it myself. ONce i put my card in the check tab.. it took them 20 mins to come by and pick it and do my transaction. My advice is dont waste your money on a place thats slow service, bland food and is over priced. Go down a block or 2 and go to Naan N Curry.. better food and 1/3 the price.
author: Deven G.

description: New Delhi is definately the place to be. The food alone is second to none. by far the best indian food ive tasted in the bay area at least! The real reason you want to go to New Delhi is the EXCELLENT staff. You've got Lois who is a superstar waiter. Very Polite very professional and also if you go a little more frequently he's actually quite humorous. He gives off a very friendly and comfortable vibe that makes you feel at home at New Delhi. I was actually there last night and there was this really problematic family causing a ruckus out of something silly, about a toy or a baby or something of some sort. And while the family was chewing him out he was very courteous very kind and very professional. Gotta say they have a ROCKSTAR staff. If you ever stick around late enough to hangout at the bar. Id definitely recommend hanging out on Sophie's Shift. Awesome at customer service. And very cute as well :P
author: Duck M.
